original: de nas 'gog pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas 'gog pa la'o //
translated: Then, in the cessation.

original: de nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la'o //
analyzed: de nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la'o //

analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems las 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems las 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //

original: de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems la gnas so //
analyzed: de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems la gnas so //
translated: Arising from that, he remains in the non-concentrated mind.

original: de nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //🔽de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems @144a * //
analyzed: de nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go // de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems @144a * //
translated: Then, he enters into the attainment of the perception-sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: la gnas so //

translated: Arising from that, he remains in the non-concentrated mind.

original: de nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched la'o //
analyzed: de nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched la'o //
translated: Then, in the perception-sphere of nothingness.

original: de nas ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems la gnas so //

original: de la chos rnams kyi mdor bsdus pa mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la chos rnams kyi mdor bsdus pa mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang /
translated: 1. the absence of the extensive, 2. the absence of the protector, the Buddha, 3. the absence of the virtues of the three times, 4. the single discrimination of the object to be apprehended.🔽The path of cultivation is the sphere of the aspects of application.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag mdo dang rgyas par bstan pa de la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag mdo dang rgyas par bstan pa de la /
translated: Bhagavan, in that way, the Tathagata has taught these dharmas in brief and in detail.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag mdo dang rgyas par kun chub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag mdo dang rgyas par kun chub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: In that, the great bodhisattva should understand these six perfections in brief and in detail.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum char mngon par rtogs pa gcig gis mdor bsdus pa bstan nas /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum char mngon par rtogs pa gcig gis mdor bsdus pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the brief and extensive realizations of the three omnisciences,

original: mngon par rtogs pa re re yang rgyas par bstan pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa re re yang rgyas par bstan pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: he taught each of the realizations in detail.

original: da ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas par bsgoms pa'i lam gyi @144b dbang du mdzad nas nye bar bkod pa dang / des spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs par shes par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: da ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas par bsgoms pa'i lam gyi @144b dbang du mdzad nas nye bar bkod pa dang / des spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs par shes par bya ba'i don du /
translated: Now, in the context of the peak realization, in order to teach the brief and extensive paths of meditation, and in order to understand the abandonment of the conceptions to be abandoned by that,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyis mdo dang rgyas pa 'tshal bar 'gyur ba lags zhus pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyis mdo dang rgyas pa 'tshal bar 'gyur ba lags zhus pas /
translated: The Bhagavān, the Blessed One, replied to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, “Maitreya, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas should understand the concise and extensive in all the sūtras.”

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid mdor bsdus pa shes pa dang / rgyas pa shes pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rnon po la sogs pa 'jug pa nyid kyis mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa brjod pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid mdor bsdus pa shes pa dang / rgyas pa shes pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rnon po la sogs pa 'jug pa nyid kyis mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa brjod pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The concise and extensive should be understood in terms of knowing the suchness of all phenomena in brief and in detail, and in terms of knowing the cause for engaging in the concise and extensive explanations for those bodhisattvas with sharp faculties and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang /
translated: What is a conception that is not the Buddha’s intention?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa la ji skad bstan pa bzhin du slob pa ni bdud kyi las mi byed pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams la zang zing gi sbyin pas tshims par bya ba dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa la ji skad bstan pa bzhin du slob pa ni bdud kyi las mi byed pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams la zang zing gi sbyin pas tshims par bya ba dang /
translated: Training in accordance with the teachings for attaining omniscience is not creating the works of Mara, not degenerating, and satisfying the beings of the three-thousand-fold world systems with material gifts through the intention of the Buddha.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la bkod pas /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la bkod pas /
translated: And through establishing them in the aggregates of morality and so forth, the fruits of stream enterer and so forth, and the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha,

original: gang de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di se go la gtogs pa tsam du bsgoms pa'i bsod nams de mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa'i rgyu nyid shes par bya ba'i don gyi phyir te /
analyzed: gang de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di se go la gtogs pa tsam du bsgoms pa'i bsod nams de mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa'i rgyu nyid shes par bya ba'i don gyi phyir te /
translated: the merit of those who meditate on this profound perfection of wisdom even to the extent of a finger snap increases greatly and is known to be the cause of the intention of the Buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad rtag pa'i rgyu can yin pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad rtag pa'i rgyu can yin pas /
translated: Because all phenomena have the cause of permanence.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyang 'di las 'khrungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyang 'di las 'khrungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because the buddhas themselves are born from this.

original: sbyor ba'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang ji skad bshad pa la gnas pa ni phyir mi ldog pa yin pas sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa dang / de la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dge pa'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dge pa'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su gzung ba dang /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang ji skad bshad pa la gnas pa ni phyir mi ldog pa yin pas sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa dang / de la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dge pa'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dge pa'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su gzung ba dang /
translated: The conception of the path of preparation is that one who abides in what has been explained is irreversible, and so one serves the buddhas, generates the roots of virtue, is taken hold of by spiritual friends,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam pa dpag tu med pa bsgoms pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam pa dpag tu med pa bsgoms pa nas brtsams te /
translated: and from the point of view of cultivating the infinite aspects of Dharma such as the six perfections,

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la phan yon 'di dag yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa ni @145a * //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la phan yon 'di dag yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa ni @145a * //
translated: it is said, “These are the benefits for those who practice the perfection of wisdom.”

original: sbyor ba'i lam gyi dus su'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gyi dus su'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the time of the path of preparation.

original: mthong ba'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conception of the path of seeing is that

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de mthong ba'i lam gyi dus su'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba'i lam gyi dus su'o //
translated: That is at the time of the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de la bsgom pa'i lam gyi dus su sems kyi phan yon mang po zhig bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de la bsgom pa'i lam gyi dus su sems kyi phan yon mang po zhig bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception that there is no path of meditation is taught by the many benefits of mind that are shown at the time of the path of meditation for one who meditates on the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyor ba'i lam mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa zhib dang / rag las pa dang / gsog dang / snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ba nyid sbyor ba'i bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa zhib dang / rag las pa dang / gsog dang / snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ba nyid sbyor ba'i bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception that the path of preparation is not known is taught in order to know just what the practice of the perfection of wisdom is, through the fact that form, etc. is subtle, dependent, void, and insubstantial.

original: de la dngos po rnams 'gog pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po rnams 'gog pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: There, it is peace because of the cessation of things.

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis na rags la pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis na rags la pa'o //
translated: It is coarse because of the power of conditions.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pas na gsog go //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pas na gsog go //
translated: It is hollow because it is empty by nature.

original: rnam par dpyad mi bzod pas na snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad mi bzod pas na snying po med pa'o //
translated: It is insubstantial because it cannot withstand analysis.

original: mthong ba'i lam mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang nam mkha' stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang nam mkha' stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrubs pas /
translated: The idea that one does not know the path of seeing is taught by the passage beginning with “the emptiness of space is accomplished” and ending with “the perfection of wisdom is accomplished.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is because the path of seeing is to be known just as it is by accomplishing the perfection of wisdom.🔽The idea that one does not know the path of meditation is taught by the passage beginning with “the emptiness of space is meditated upon” and ending with “the perfection of wisdom is meditated upon.”

original: bsgom pa'i lam mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang nam mkha' stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyi ro zhes bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: yang nam mkha' zhes smos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam ni mthong pa'i lam las dngos po tha mi dad par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the mention of space is for the purpose of understanding that the path of meditative development is not a different entity from the path of vision.

original: de la nam mkha' stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' zhes smos pas ni gcig yin no //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' zhes smos pas ni gcig yin no //
translated: In this respect, the establishment of the emptiness of space is one, i.e. the mention of space.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yid la mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang theg pa gzhan gyi yid la bya ba go skabs med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //

translated: The conception of nonattention to the vehicles of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha is taught by “because there is no opportunity for attention to other vehicles. ”

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa'i nam par rtog pa ni gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba mi 'dor bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ba nyid dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi rgyu ba de ltar spyad pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa'i nam par rtog pa ni gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba mi 'dor bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ba nyid dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi rgyu ba de ltar spyad pa dang /
translated: The conception of the night of not attending to perfect complete enlightenment is the practice of the perfection of wisdom by not abandoning attention to the knowledge of all aspects, and the non-movement of mind and mental factor dharmas.

original: de ltar mngon par bsgrub par gsungs pa dang / de'i spyod pa dang / mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa bkag pa dang / theg pa chen po skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par bsgrub par gsungs pa dang / de'i spyod pa dang / mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa bkag pa dang / theg pa chen po skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is said that one should practice and accomplish in that way, and it is taught that the practice, accomplishment, and meditation of that are refuted as the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects, and that it should be understood that the Great Vehicle is realized in a single instant.

original: bsgom pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni de ltar bsgoms pa nyid kyis de ni rgyun chags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni de ltar bsgoms pa nyid kyis de ni rgyun chags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conception of meditation is that, by meditating in that way, it is continuous.

original: 'dod pa'i don yin par mi 'thad pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don yin par mi 'thad pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught in order to understand that it is not tenable as the object of desire.🔽The conception of non-meditation is taught in order to understand the application that is to be discarded at the time of no-more-learning through just such meditation.🔽The conception of neither meditation nor non-meditation is taught in order to understand that the attainment of omniscience is not interrupted by meditation or non-meditation.🔽The conception of neither an object of meditation nor an act of meditation is taught in order to understand that the attainment of omniscience is not interrupted by meditation or non-meditation.

original: bsgom pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de ltar bsgoms pa nyid kyis mi slob pa'i dus su dor ba'i sbyor ba shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no ;🔽/ bsgom pa yang med /
analyzed: bsgom pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de ltar bsgoms pa nyid kyis mi slob pa'i dus su dor ba'i sbyor ba shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no ; / bsgom pa yang med /
translated: The conception of neither an object of meditation nor an act of meditation is taught in order to understand that the attainment of omniscience is not interrupted by meditation or non-meditation.

original: bsgom pa ma yin pa yang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang bsgoms pas kyang ma yin /🔽ma bsgoms pas kyang ma yin pa'i phyir /

original: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang zhig mya ngan las 'das pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang zhig mya ngan las 'das pa yang gzhan la /
translated: The conception of neither an object of meditation nor an act of meditation is taught in order to understand that the attainment of omniscience is not interrupted by meditation

original: thob pa yang gzhan par sems pa'i dbang du mdzad pa ni de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pa yang gzhan par sems pa'i dbang du mdzad pa ni de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: And the attainment is also taught from the perspective of the other mind, as in “attainment of the knowledge of all aspects just as it is.”

original: da ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun phyogs 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun phyogs 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the conception of the adverse factors of the path of cultivation should be explained.🔽Among them, first, the conception of the object of engagement:

original: de la re zhig / sems can btags pa'i spyod yul dang // chos btags pa dang stong min nyid //
analyzed: de la re zhig / sems can btags pa'i spyod yul dang // chos btags pa dang stong min nyid //
translated: The object of engagement is sentient beings, the imputed, phenomena, and non-emptiness.🔽Attachment, differentiation, the nature of things, making things real, the three vehicles,

original: chags dang rab 'byed bdag nyid dang // dngos por byed dang theg gsum dang // yon ni dag pa ma yin dang // spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa la //
analyzed: chags dang rab 'byed bdag nyid dang // dngos por byed dang theg gsum dang // yon ni dag pa ma yin dang // spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa la //

original: 'dzin par byed pa dang po ni //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa dang po ni //
translated: are the first conception of grasping.

original: shes par bya ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: shes par bya ba nyid dang ni //
translated: The object of knowledge is the object of engagement.

original: zhes bstan pa la ;
analyzed: zhes bstan pa la ;
translated: This is taught.

original: de la sems can du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang sems can la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de la sems can du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang sems can la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Among them, the conception of sentient beings is that which, due to the non-apprehension of sentient beings and so forth,

original: sems can gyi khams su gtogs pa bkag pa'i phyir yin no //🔽de lta yin na sems can dmyal ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams su gtogs pa bkag pa'i phyir yin no // de lta yin na sems can dmyal ba nas brtsams te /
translated: because it is included in the realm of sentient beings.🔽If that is so, then it follows that there is no designation from the hells

analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du btags pa med par thal par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: up to the perfect Buddha.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sems can du gdags pa dmigs su yod dam /
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa dmigs su yod dam /
translated: Is the designation of sentient beings something that can be apprehended?

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can du btags pa ni dngos po med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can du btags pa ni dngos po med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Up to here it has been taught that the designation of sentient beings is to be understood as unreal.

original: chos su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang chos su btags pa la slob pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang chos su btags pa la slob pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: The conceptualization of the designation of phenomena is in order to express the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects by one who trains in the designation of phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'on byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'on byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Blessed One, then how should a bodhisattva great being

original: gzugs la bslab par gyi 'am zhes bya bas nye bar dmigs pa la bslab pa thams cad bkag pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bri ba dang / bsnan pa med par bslab par gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la bslab par gyi 'am zhes bya bas nye bar dmigs pa la bslab pa thams cad bkag pas so zhes bstan pa yin no // stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bri ba dang / bsnan pa med par bslab par gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase should train in form indicates that all training in the apprehended object is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the non-emptiness of form indicates that all training in the apprehending subject is refuted.🔽 The phrase should train in the emptiness of form indicates that all training in the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of emptiness indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.

original: chos thams cad @146b rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid du mthong bas /
analyzed: chos thams cad @146b rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid du mthong bas /
translated: The phrase should train in the emptiness of ultimate reality indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of the conditioned indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of the unconditioned indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of the inexpressible indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of the past indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of the future indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of the present indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of the past, future, and present indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.

original: de slob pa nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin na /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas /🔽rab 'byor spyod pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de slob pa nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin na / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas / rab 'byor spyod pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The phrase should train in the emptiness of the internal indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of the external indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of the internal and external indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsgom pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsgom pa de'i tshe /
translated: The phrase should train in the emptiness of emptiness indicates that all training in the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is refuted.🔽The phrase should train in the emptiness of the great

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i lan gyi bar gyis gnyis dang gnyis su med pa dag dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa nyid du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i lan gyi bar gyis gnyis dang gnyis su med pa dag dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa nyid du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The reply up to “one should meditate on it by way of non-apprehension” teaches that the two and non-duality are both apprehended and not apprehended.

original: chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa dag la chags pa bkag pas de lta na ni sa nas sa gzhan du 'pho zhing de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa dag la chags pa bkag pas de lta na ni sa nas sa gzhan du 'pho zhing de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: The conceptualization of attachment is that which is attached to both apprehension and non-apprehension. By the negation of that, it is taught that “one does not pass from one stage to another, and one does not perfect it.”

original: dmigs pa la gnas na de yongs su rdzogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa la gnas na de yongs su rdzogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if one abides in apprehension, one is not able to perfect it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dmigs su med ces gang gsung pa'i lan gyi 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dmigs su med ces gang gsung pa'i lan gyi 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The reply to the question “Why is that?” is taught by the statement “because the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.”

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de ltar chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med pas /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de ltar chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med pas /
translated: The conceptualization of the discrimination of phenomena is that which discriminates phenomena in that way.

original: ji ltar nye bar dmigs pa de ltar chos rnam par 'byed par mi byed do zhes mi dmigs pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yin par gnang ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar dmigs pa de ltar chos rnam par 'byed par mi byed do zhes mi dmigs pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yin par gnang ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the discernment of nonapprehension.

original: dngos po'i ched du bya ba byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de yin na sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' dag mdzad par mi rigs pas spyod pa de ni su yang byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ched du bya ba byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de yin na sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' dag mdzad par mi rigs pas spyod pa de ni su yang byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The conceptualization of the function of things is that which is not, since it is not reasonable that the Buddha should perform all the deeds of a Buddha, that performance would not be done by anyone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ma byas pa ste /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it is taught that all things are unmade,

original: mngon par ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because they are not made manifest.

original: theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de lta yin na theg pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ba dang / gzugs la mngon par zhen nas de rnams la rlom sems dang ldan pa'i theg pa gsum du rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de lta yin na theg pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ba dang / gzugs la mngon par zhen nas de rnams la rlom sems dang ldan pa'i theg pa gsum du rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: If that were so, the classifications of the three vehicles would not exist, and those who cling to form and have pride in it would be classified as belonging to the three vehicles.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽All phenomena are not seen even by the five eyes of the buddhas.

original: chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan lngas kyang ma gzigs pa dang / de lta na ni bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi phung po gsum du lung ston par @147a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan lngas kyang ma gzigs pa dang / de lta na ni bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi phung po gsum du lung ston par @147a * //
translated: If that were so, the Bhagavān would not have given prophecies to the three groups of sentient beings.

original: mdzad pa med pa dang / rdzas ma yin pa la rdzas su 'du shes pa de zlog par byed pa'i don dang / de ltar bstan pas don dam pa'am de las bzlog pa la zhugs nas /
analyzed: mdzad pa med pa dang / rdzas ma yin pa la rdzas su 'du shes pa de zlog par byed pa'i don dang / de ltar bstan pas don dam pa'am de las bzlog pa la zhugs nas /
translated: The meaning of reversing the notion that what is not a substance is a substance is that, by teaching that, one would engage in the ultimate or the opposite of that.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bkag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i dpes 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la gnas pa bkag pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' dag mdzad par gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bkag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i dpes 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la gnas pa bkag pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' dag mdzad par gsungs pa dang /
translated: And by refuting the existence of the unconditioned and the conditioned, it is said that the Tathagata performs all the deeds of a perfect Buddha.

original: de lta na ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang sprul pa la khyad med par thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta na ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang sprul pa la khyad med par thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: But if this were so, it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no difference between the Tathagata and his emanations.

original: byed pa po'i sprul pa dang bcas pa'i dgongs pa shes par bya ba'i don dang / de gnyi ga'i don byed pa'i khyad par bye brag med par gsungs pas /
analyzed: byed pa po'i sprul pa dang bcas pa'i dgongs pa shes par bya ba'i don dang / de gnyi ga'i don byed pa'i khyad par bye brag med par gsungs pas /
translated: Thus, it is said that the Tathagata and his emanations are not different in terms of their purpose, which is to know the thoughts of the creator of emanations, nor are they different in terms of their function, which is to perform the deeds of the creator of emanations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i smon lam gyi rjes su byed pas de gnyi ga'i khyad par brjod pa dang / sprul par mdzad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang sprul pa'i dpes byed pa po'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i dpes zhes bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i smon lam gyi rjes su byed pas de gnyi ga'i khyad par brjod pa dang / sprul par mdzad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang sprul pa'i dpes byed pa po'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i dpes zhes bstan pa yin no /
translated: The analogy of the emanator and the emanation is taught in order to eliminate the conception of an agent, by following the prayer of the Tathagata's presence, and by expressing the difference between the two.

original: yon ma dag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de lta yin na yon yongs su dag pa med pas /
analyzed: yon ma dag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de lta yin na yon yongs su dag pa med pas /
translated: The conception of impure gifts is this: If that is so, then there is no pure gift,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang sprul pa de dag chos nyid kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang sprul pa de dag chos nyid kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no difference in reality between the Tathagata and his emanations.

original: yon gyi gnas khyad par du 'gyur ba med pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la dmigs pa'i byams pa'i sems dang / de yid la byas shing nam mkha' la me tog 'thor bar byed pa dang / sangs rgyas yid la byed pa dag kyang yon phul ba des sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yon gyi gnas khyad par du 'gyur ba med pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la dmigs pa'i byams pa'i sems dang / de yid la byas shing nam mkha' la me tog 'thor bar byed pa dang / sangs rgyas yid la byed pa dag kyang yon phul ba des sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the field of merit does not become superior, and the mind of love focused on the Tathagata, and the mental activity of scattering flowers in the sky, and the mental activity of the Buddha, are taught to be the end of suffering through the offering of gifts.

original: dgu pa spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos nyid mi 'khrugs pa'i spyod pa gsungs pa dang / de lta na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos la nges par rtogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid rnam par 'khrugs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: dgu pa spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi chos nyid mi 'khrugs pa'i spyod pa gsungs pa dang / de lta na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos la nges par rtogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid rnam par 'khrugs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: But if one definitely understands phenomena such as form, then the reality of the Tathagata is disturbed.

original: gzhan dag rnam pa med pa de la 'jug par bya ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa chos rnams kyi ming dang mtshan ma ston pas chos nyid 'khrugs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag rnam pa med pa de la 'jug par bya ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa chos rnams kyi ming dang mtshan ma ston pas chos nyid 'khrugs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to introduce others to that non-aspect, the Tathagata teaches the names and signs of phenomena, and so reality is undisturbed.

original: @147b rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang / bud med smos pas za ma dang / ma ning dang / 'bras bu ston pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: @147b rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang / bud med smos pas za ma dang / ma ning dang / 'bras bu ston pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: Son or daughter of good lineage.

original: gtogs pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: gtogs pa'i don yin no //
translated: Since it mentions men and women, it refers to neuters, eunuchs, hermaphrodites, and so forth, or else it refers to those who are included in the four castes.

original: rigs kyi khyad par smos pa ni rigs bzhi rnam par dag pa shes par bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: rigs kyi khyad par smos pa ni rigs bzhi rnam par dag pa shes par bya ba'i don no //
translated: The mention of the particular lineage is for the purpose of knowing the purity of the four castes.

original: bu dang bu mo zhes smos pa ni rab tu byung ba'i skye bo dang / rjes su mthun par smra ba shes par bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: bu dang bu mo zhes smos pa ni rab tu byung ba'i skye bo dang / rjes su mthun par smra ba shes par bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The terms “son” and “daughter” are used to indicate the person who has gone forth.

original: rigs smos pas ni rgyud phun sum tshogs pa dam pa'i chos la dbang du bya ba shes par bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: rigs smos pas ni rgyud phun sum tshogs pa dam pa'i chos la dbang du bya ba shes par bya ba'i don no //
translated: The term “family” is used to indicate the perfection of the continuum, which is the basis for the mastery of the true Dharma.

original: yang 'am zhes smos pa ni skye gnas dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i dpes ni skal ba can du gyur pa'i nyes pas rigs ngan par gyur pa dag kyang 'dir skal ba dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas par shes par bya ba'i don yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang 'am zhes smos pa ni skye gnas dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i dpes ni skal ba can du gyur pa'i nyes pas rigs ngan par gyur pa dag kyang 'dir skal ba dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas par shes par bya ba'i don yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The term “also” is used to indicate that those who have become unfortunate due to the fault of having a bad rebirth or due to having to experience the results of bad karma in another life are also considered to be fortunate in this context.

original: da ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa brjod par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa brjod par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Now, the second conception of grasping should be stated, so it is said:

original: sems can btags pa de yi rgyu'i //
analyzed: sems can btags pa de yi rgyu'i //
translated: The basis for the designation of sentient beings

original: yul can bsgom pa'i lam 'brel ba //
analyzed: yul can bsgom pa'i lam 'brel ba //
translated: Is the object of the path of cultivation.

original: de la gnod pa byed pa yis //
analyzed: de la gnod pa byed pa yis //
translated: By harming that,

original: mi mthun phyogs rnams rnam pa dgu //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs rnams rnam pa dgu //
translated: The adverse factors are of nine types.

original: zhes bstan pa la /🔽gang rab 'byor tha snyad dang / ming dang mtshan ma la mngon bar chags pa ma yin te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa la / gang rab 'byor tha snyad dang / ming dang mtshan ma la mngon bar chags pa ma yin te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: This is taught.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bstan pa'i bar gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bstan pa'i bar gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: From “Subhūti, it is not that you are attached to conventions, names, and signs” up to “the attainment of omniscience is taught.”

original: ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it ninefold?🔽Therefore it is taught:

original: de'i phyir / thams cad mkhyen nyid gsum dag gi //
analyzed: de'i phyir / thams cad mkhyen nyid gsum dag gi //
translated: The three omnisciences

original: bdag nyid ji bzhin sgrib rnam gsum //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji bzhin sgrib rnam gsum //
translated: are the three obscurations, just as they are.🔽The nature of the afflictions is explained as the final🔽of the nine:🔽the equality of suchness and so on,🔽being associated and not associated,🔽unequal suffering, and so on,

original: zhi bde bzhin nyid sogs dang // mtshungs par ldan dang mi ldan dang // mi mnyam sdug bsngal la sogs dang // nyon mongs rnams kyi rang bzhin dang // gnyis su med la kun rmongs dang // rnam par rtog pa tha mar bzhed //🔽ces bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: zhi bde bzhin nyid sogs dang // mtshungs par ldan dang mi ldan dang // mi mnyam sdug bsngal la sogs dang // nyon mongs rnams kyi rang bzhin dang // gnyis su med la kun rmongs dang // rnam par rtog pa tha mar bzhed //🔽ces bstan pa yin no /
translated: nonduality, and confusion.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la kun du rmongs pa ni gang ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bgyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽rnam pa gang dang / rtags gang dang / mtshan ma gang gis de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pas /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la kun du rmongs pa ni gang ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bgyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / rnam pa gang dang / rtags gang dang / mtshan ma gang gis de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pas /
translated: Regarding that, the confusion about the knowledge of all aspects is from the question, “For what reason is the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Complete Buddha called the one with the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad @148a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad @148a * //
translated: and the answer, “It is because of the knowledge of all aspects by the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Complete Buddha,

original: mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽lam shes pa nyid la kun du rmongs pa ni gang /🔽rab 'byor lam thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bskyed par bya zhes pa la sogs pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no // lam shes pa nyid la kun du rmongs pa ni gang / rab 'byor lam thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bskyed par bya zhes pa la sogs pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: that he is called the one with the knowledge of all aspects.”🔽The confusion about the knowledge of paths is from the statement, “Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should generate all paths.”

original: thams cad shes pa nyid la kun du rmongs pa ni gang /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid la kun du rmongs pa ni gang /
translated: The confusion about the knowledge of all aspects is from the statement, “Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should generate the path to omniscience.”

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ces bya ba ni nang dang phyi'i bdag nyid can gyi chos 'di dag yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ces bya ba ni nang dang phyi'i bdag nyid can gyi chos 'di dag yin la /
translated: Subhūti, “all phenomena” refers to these phenomena that have the nature of the internal and the external.

original: de dag thams cad nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes te zhes bya ba la sogs pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes te zhes bya ba la sogs pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that “all of them are known by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.”

original: lam la kun du rmongs pa ni gang lam la gnas pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lam la kun du rmongs pa ni gang lam la gnas pa nas brtsams te /
translated: “Delusion about the path” is from the point of view of abiding on the path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gang zag thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa mchog gi pha rol tu 'gro ba yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gang zag thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa mchog gi pha rol tu 'gro ba yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the ārya path is the supreme nirvāṇa of all persons, it is taught that it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: dmigs pa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: “Object” is the object.

original: de dag dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa la kun du rmongs pa ni gang yang de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings 'di khongs su chud pa'i don dang / chos gang gis kyang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa la sogs pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa la kun du rmongs pa ni gang yang de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings 'di khongs su chud pa'i don dang / chos gang gis kyang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa la sogs pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The delusion regarding the possession and non-possession of these is the perfection of wisdom itself, because of the meaning included in this suchness, reality-limit, and dharma-element, and because of the meaning of possession and non-possession by any dharma.

original: mi mnyam pa nyid ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa nyid ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The non-equality is the non-commonality.

original: de la rmongs pa ni gang yang phyir rgol ba dang / mu stegs pa dang / bdud dang / theg pa gzhan thams cad kyis mi chod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rmongs pa ni gang yang phyir rgol ba dang / mu stegs pa dang / bdud dang / theg pa gzhan thams cad kyis mi chod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The delusion regarding that is the perfection of wisdom itself, because of the meaning of being unassailable by any opponent, tīrthika, māra, or other vehicle, and because of the meaning of being unassailable.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la kun du rmongs pa ni gang yang sdug bsngal gyi don nam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la kun du rmongs pa ni gang yang sdug bsngal gyi don nam /
translated: The delusion regarding the truths of suffering, etc. is the perfection of wisdom itself, because of the meaning of suffering,

original: sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa'i don la spyad par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa'i don la spyad par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is taught to be the object of practice.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin la kun du rmongs pa ni gang yang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi don la spyod pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin la kun du rmongs pa ni gang yang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi don la spyod pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Delusion about the nature of the afflictions is to engage in the meaning of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi de bzhin nyid ni gang gi yang don mi byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi de bzhin nyid ni gang gi yang don mi byed /
translated: The suchness of desire, anger, and ignorance does not perform any meaning,

original: don ma yin pa yang mi byed do zhes 'thad pa bstan pa @148b yin no //
analyzed: don ma yin pa yang mi byed do zhes 'thad pa bstan pa @148b yin no //
translated: nor does it perform any non-meaning. This is the teaching of logic.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad kyi don dang don ma yin pa la spyod pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad kyi don dang don ma yin pa la spyod pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the engagement in meaning and non-meaning of all phenomena is refuted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /🔽chos gang don du bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas / chos gang don du bya ba'am /
translated: The Tathāgata, having fully awakened,🔽did not observe any phenomenon that performs meaning

original: don med par bya ba ma dmigs te /
analyzed: don med par bya ba ma dmigs te /
translated: or performs non-meaning.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: Whether conditioned phenomena

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang yang mi byed pas /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang yang mi byed pas /
translated: Because it does not perform any unconditioned dharma.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dang don mi byed pa bkag pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dang don mi byed pa bkag pas /
translated: The meaning of the perfection of wisdom is not to perform any meaning or non-meaning.

original: 'phags pa thams cad 'dus ma byas kyi don gyis na de'i don nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i dpes phan pa dang / gnod pa med pas don dang don ma yin pa gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad 'dus ma byas kyi don gyis na de'i don nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i dpes phan pa dang / gnod pa med pas don dang don ma yin pa gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that because the noble ones attain omniscience by the meaning of the unconditioned, by the example of space, which is similar to its meaning, by the method of non-harmfulness, and by the method of non-duality of meaning and non-meaning.

original: gnyis su med pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: Non-duality is non-duality.

original: don dam pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'o //
translated: It is ultimate.

original: de la kun du rmongs pa ni gang gnyis su med pa'i chos kyis gnyis su med pa'i chos thob pa bkag pa dang / gnyis kyi chos shig gnyis kyi chos kyis thob pa bkag pa dang / gnyis dang gnyis su med pa'i chos mi dmigs pa na thob pa yin par bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la kun du rmongs pa ni gang gnyis su med pa'i chos kyis gnyis su med pa'i chos thob pa bkag pa dang / gnyis kyi chos shig gnyis kyi chos kyis thob pa bkag pa dang / gnyis dang gnyis su med pa'i chos mi dmigs pa na thob pa yin par bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that in that regard, confusion is explained as the obstruction of attaining the non-dual dharma by the non-dual dharma, the obstruction of attaining the dual dharma by the dual dharma, and the non-apprehension of the dual and non-dual dharmas.

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbye ba rgya cher bshad pas dngos po thams cad la mngon par zhen pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbye ba rgya cher bshad pas dngos po thams cad la mngon par zhen pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the extensive explanation of the differentiation of the modes of the conceptualization of that is the counteragent to the adherence to all things.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dmigs su med pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dmigs su med pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, the knowledge of all modes is not apprehended.

original: de ltar byas na dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the knowledge that has a non-thing for its objective support is tenable.

original: 'dir lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa med pa nyid kyis 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad med par 'gyur zhes zhus pa la /
analyzed: 'dir lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa med pa nyid kyis 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad med par 'gyur zhes zhus pa la /
translated: Here, the objection is that if the path and nirvāṇa do not exist, then all ārya persons do not exist.

original: thams cad 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
translated: The reply is that since all are distinguished by the unconditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas pa ni 'byung ba med pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi mtshan mar byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa ni 'byung ba med pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi mtshan mar byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
translated: the unconditioned is taken as the sign of the world by the non-arising itself.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam pa'i tshig gis don du btags pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshig gis don du btags pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //
translated: The statement “The ultimate is not a designation” is tenable.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' shes pas mtha' yongs su chad pa ni zhus pa yin la /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' shes pas mtha' yongs su chad pa ni zhus pa yin la /
translated: The question is: “How can the end of the world be known?”

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams la de'i mtha' mi shes pas mi shes pa dang ldan pa la de bstan to zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //🔽de bas na dngos po @149a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams la de'i mtha' mi shes pas mi shes pa dang ldan pa la de bstan to zhes bya ba ni lan yin no // de bas na dngos po @149a * //
translated: The answer is: “The end of the world is not known by those who are ignorant of the nature of things.

original: med pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of the nonexistence of things is tenable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can rnams kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can rnams kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason, the Lord said, ‘Bodhisattva, great being, those who, for the sake of sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'jug pa la sems can du btags pa yang mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'jug pa la sems can du btags pa yang mi dmigs shing /
translated: are engaged in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, do not apprehend sentient beings,

original: sems can du 'dzin pa las yongs su 'brel ba ni dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can du 'dzin pa las yongs su 'brel ba ni dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: and are completely free from the grasping of sentient beings, they are doing what is difficult.’

original: yams nad 'di rnams zad nas ni //
analyzed: yams nad 'di rnams zad nas ni //
translated: Just as, after the exhaustion of these epidemics,

original: yun ring lon nas dbugs phyin ltar //
analyzed: yun ring lon nas dbugs phyin ltar //
translated: after a long time, there is relief,🔽in the same way, the great being,🔽the hero with the supreme fruit,

original: rnam pa kun du 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du 'gro ba yi //
translated: is the support in every way🔽for the accomplishment of the happiness of all beings,

original: bde bsgrub yon tan phun tshogs kun //
analyzed: bde bsgrub yon tan phun tshogs kun //
translated: for the complete perfection of all good qualities,

original: rgya mtsho che la chu bo bzhin //🔽'bras bu mchog gis dpa' ba yi //🔽sems dpa' chen po de la ni //🔽rnam pa kun du rten par byed //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgya mtsho che la chu bo bzhin // 'bras bu mchog gis dpa' ba yi // sems dpa' chen po de la ni // rnam pa kun du rten par byed // ces bya ba ni /
translated: like the great ocean for the four great rivers.

original: gang ljang bu'i sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i dpes byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi zhing nyid yin pa'i phyir /🔽'gro ba ma lus pa'i bde ba'i longs spyod mchog mang zhing /
analyzed: gang ljang bu'i sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i dpes byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi zhing nyid yin pa'i phyir / 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bde ba'i longs spyod mchog mang zhing /
translated: This verse shows that the Bodhisattva is like a fine garden, because he is the field of merit for all beings, as illustrated by the example of the bamboo tree with its abundant fruits of leaves, flowers, and fruits.🔽He is the hero with the supreme fruit, who is beautiful with the enjoyment of the supreme happiness of all beings.

original: sna tshogs pa'i don gyis na skyed mos tshal bzang po dang 'dra bar 'bras bu mchog gis dpa' zhing mdzes pa de lta bu de ni bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i don gyis na skyed mos tshal bzang po dang 'dra bar 'bras bu mchog gis dpa' zhing mdzes pa de lta bu de ni bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: He should be known as the Tathagata himself.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'thob pa'i 'thad pa dang / de ltar de bzhin nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'thob pa'i 'thad pa dang / de ltar de bzhin nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa na /
translated: and for the purity of the perfection of wisdom in that way,

original: dbang po yongs su rdzogs pa dang / las rang gis byas pa dang / smon pa'i ye shes dang / dus kyi ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / sems can rnams kyi don dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa dang /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su rdzogs pa dang / las rang gis byas pa dang / smon pa'i ye shes dang / dus kyi ye shes rnam par dag pa dang / sems can rnams kyi don dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa dang /
translated: the perfection of the faculties, the karma one has done oneself, the wisdom of aspiration, the wisdom of time, the benefit of accomplishing the aims of sentient beings, the purification of a buddhafield, the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phan yon thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phan yon thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, and the parinirvāṇa of sentient beings.

original: 'di'i mdo ni /
analyzed: 'di'i mdo ni /
translated: The sūtra for this is as follows:🔽Subhūti, it is thus.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: skyes bu la la zhig ljang bu bskyed par 'dod la /
analyzed: skyes bu la la zhig ljang bu bskyed par 'dod la /
translated: some person wishes to grow a bamboo plant.

original: skyes bu des ljang bu de'i rtsa ba ma dmigs /
analyzed: skyes bu des ljang bu de'i rtsa ba ma dmigs /
translated: That person does not see the root of that bamboo plant,

original: yal ga dang / sdong bu dang / @149b lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu ma dmigs par ljang bu de'i sdong bu bskyed de /
analyzed: yal ga dang / sdong bu dang / @149b lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu ma dmigs par ljang bu de'i sdong bu bskyed de /
translated: and he does not apprehend branches, a trunk, leaves, flowers, or fruits.

original: dus dus su chus bran zhing /
analyzed: dus dus su chus bran zhing /
translated: He waters it from time to time,🔽and that trunk gradually grows branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits,🔽and those fruits are enjoyed from time to time.🔽In the same way, bodhisattva great beings,

original: de'i sdong bu de rim gyis yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu la spyod pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang sems can rnams kyi phyir /
analyzed: de'i sdong bu de rim gyis yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu la spyod pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang sems can rnams kyi phyir /
translated: for the sake of sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par 'jug ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par 'jug ste /
translated: set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de dag rim gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: de dag rim gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: and they gradually practice the six perfections,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed de /
translated: and they make them reach the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de dag lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu ltar sems can thams cad 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu ltar sems can thams cad 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And all sentient beings live on those leaves, flowers, and fruits.🔽“

original: de la lo ma ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la brten cing sems can rnams ngan song gsum las yongs su sgrol ba'i //🔽me tog ni gang la brten cing rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu nas /
analyzed: de la lo ma ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la brten cing sems can rnams ngan song gsum las yongs su sgrol ba'i // me tog ni gang la brten cing rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu nas /
translated: The leaves are those bodhisattva-mahāsattvas on whom sentient beings rely and are completely liberated from the three lower realms.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi lha rnams su skye'o //🔽de la 'bras bu ni 'di yin te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' chen po gang la brten nas /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi lha rnams su skye'o // de la 'bras bu ni 'di yin te / byang chub sems dpa' chen po gang la brten nas /
translated: The flowers are those on whom sentient beings rely and are reborn among the gods of the great sāla tree-like royal family, up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rab tu gnas so //
translated: The fruits are those on whom sentient beings rely and are established in the fruit of stream-entry, up to the state of a worthy one, individual enlightenment, and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad kyi 'bras bu mchog du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad kyi 'bras bu mchog du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices like this becomes the supreme fruit for all sentient beings, and so on.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: is the uninterrupted meditative stabilization of the bodhisattva on the peak stage.🔽The uninterrupted meditative stabilization🔽is the uninterrupted meditative stabilization of the bodhisattva on the peak stage.🔽The uninterrupted meditative stabilization

analyzed: // / sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rtse mo'i de ma thag par chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin pas de bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin // stong dang stong gnyis gsum skye bo //

analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin // zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The uninterrupted meditative stabilization🔽is the uninterrupted meditative stabilization of the bodhisattva on the peak stage.🔽The uninterrupted meditative stabilization🔽is the uninterrupted meditative stabilization of the bodhisattva on the peak stage.🔽The uninterrupted meditative stabilization🔽is the uninterrupted meditative stabilization of the bodhisattva on the peak stage.🔽The uninterrupted meditative stabilization🔽is the uninterrupted meditative stabilization of the bodhisattva on the peak stage.🔽The uninterrupted meditative stabilization
