analyzed: gang de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen pa'o 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag @150a * //
translated: is the uninterrupted meditative stabilization of the bodhisattva on the peak stage.

original: thams cad nyan thos kyis la gnas par gyur pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis la gnas par gyur pa bas /
analyzed: thams cad nyan thos kyis la gnas par gyur pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis la gnas par gyur pa bas /
translated: and all of them were established in the śrāvaka level and the pratyekabuddha level.

original: de rnams ni byang chub sems d'a las byung ba nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de rnams ni byang chub sems d'a las byung ba nyid kyis na /
translated: But those who have arisen from the mind of awakening

original: sems can thams cad la dmigs te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dmigs te /
translated: focus on all sentient beings

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni /
translated: and generate the mind of awakening for unsurpassed, complete, and perfect awakening.

original: bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid yin no //
translated: This is the increase in merit.

original: de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la bkod pa dang / de bzhin du rigs kyis dang / de bzhin du brgyad pa'i sa dang / de bzhin du mthong pa'i sa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la bkod pa dang / de bzhin du rigs kyis dang / de bzhin du brgyad pa'i sa dang / de bzhin du mthong pa'i sa dang /
translated: In the same way, suppose that all the sentient beings of a great trichiliocosm were established in the Joyful level, and in the same way, in the Stainless level, the Radiant level, the Brilliant level, the Hard-to-Overcome level, the Realized level, the Far-Reaching level, the Immovable level, the Excellent Wisdom level, and the Cloud of Dharma level.

original: de bzhin du bsrabs pa'i sa dang / de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyen med par zhugs pa la bzhag pas bas byang chub sems pa'i byang chub la zhugs pa'i bsod nams mang du skye ba nyid kyis bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de'i rjes thogs nyid la 'tshang rgya ba nyid yin par shes par🔽bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsrabs pa'i sa dang / de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyen med par zhugs pa la bzhag pas bas byang chub sems pa'i byang chub la zhugs pa'i bsod nams mang du skye ba nyid kyis bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de'i rjes thogs nyid la 'tshang rgya ba nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One should understand that the uninterrupted meditative stabilization is the very attainment of enlightenment immediately after that, because the bodhisattva's entry to enlightenment generates much merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub la zhugs pa ni 'bras bu bzhi'i gnas la zhugs par gyur pa yin gyi gnas brgyad pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub la zhugs pa ni 'bras bu bzhi'i gnas la zhugs par gyur pa yin gyi gnas brgyad pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered to enlightenment is one who has entered to the four fruits, but not to the eighth stage.

original: de ji lar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How is that to be understood?

original: gang gi phyir rjes thogs nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyad par smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes thogs nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyad par smos te /
translated: Because immediately after that, the special qualities of the Tathagata are mentioned.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu zhugs pa rnam pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams ches mang du rab tu sdud pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu zhugs pa rnam pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams ches mang du rab tu sdud pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has set out for enlightenment collects much more merit than the Tathāgata.

original: yang ting nge 'dzin 'di'i rjes thogs la de ma thag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sangs rgya ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang ting nge 'dzin 'di'i rjes thogs la de ma thag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sangs rgya ba nyid do //
translated: And immediately after this samādhi, there is buddhahood, because it is the immediate cause.

original: / gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: / gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //
translated: It is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ces bstan pa ni gang /
analyzed: ces bstan pa ni gang /
translated: What is taught?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin la bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin la bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is thus: the knowledge of all aspects.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: 'di yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
analyzed: 'di yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
translated: Its object is non-entityness,

original: bdag po dran pa yin par bzhed //
analyzed: bdag po dran pa yin par bzhed //
translated: and mindfulness is considered its dominant condition.

original: rnam pa zhi nyid ces bya ba ni gang de'i dmigs pa dang / bdag pa dang / rnam pa la lan du dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa nyid yin pa dang / bdag po ni dran pa nyid @150b yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa zhi nyid ces bya ba ni gang de'i dmigs pa dang / bdag pa dang / rnam pa la lan du dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa nyid yin pa dang / bdag po ni dran pa nyid @150b yin no //
translated: The phrase its aspect is peace means that its object, dominant condition, and aspect are non-entityness, and mindfulness is its dominant condition.

original: rnam pa ni zhi ba nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni zhi ba nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The aspect is peace.

original: 'gog pa shes pa'ang zhi ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa'ang zhi ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: The knowledge of cessation is also peace.

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The characteristic is the characteristic.

original: 'dis ni 'dir rang bzhin gyis zhi ba yin par bshad kyi dngos po 'gog pa'i zhi ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dir rang bzhin gyis zhi ba yin par bshad kyi dngos po 'gog pa'i zhi ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: This explains that here, the nature is peace, but it is not peace as the cessation of things.

original: da ni log par rtog pa brjod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: da ni log par rtog pa brjod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Now, the misconceptions should be stated.

original: 'di la ni /
analyzed: 'di la ni /
translated: Here,

original: rab tu smra rnams brgyud mar rgol //🔽zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: rab tu smra rnams brgyud mar rgol // zhes bstan pa la /
translated: the logicians debate in succession.🔽Here,

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gnas 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gnas 'di la'o //
translated: in this context.

original: rab tu smra rnams zhes bya ba ni log par zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rab tu smra rnams zhes bya ba ni log par zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: The logicians are those who engage in misconceptions.

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud mar sna tshogs par rgol pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud mar sna tshogs par rgol pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i rtogs pa'am /
translated: They debate by engaging in various arguments from one to another.

original: de la sel ba tsam du smra ba rgol zhing //
analyzed: de la sel ba tsam du smra ba rgol zhing //
translated: There, the logicians who propound mere elimination debate.

original: tshig tu smra ba'i lam mthar thug pa med pas shar cher smra ba rtsod pa byed do //
analyzed: tshig tu smra ba'i lam mthar thug pa med pas shar cher smra ba rtsod pa byed do //
translated: Since the path of verbal debate is endless, the logicians debate extensively.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dmigs pa 'thad dang de yi ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa 'thad dang de yi ni /
translated: The object, its tenability,🔽The ascertainment of its nature,🔽The gnosis of omniscience,🔽The ultimate and the superficial,🔽The three jewels together with the means,

original: ngo bo nyid nges bzung ba dang // rnam kun mkhyen nyid ye shes dang // dam pa'i don dang kun rdzob dang // sbyor dang dkon mchog gsum po dang // thabs dang bcas pa'i rtogs pa dang // phyin ci log ni lam bcas dang // gnyen po mi mthun phyogs dag dang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid nges bzung ba dang // rnam kun mkhyen nyid ye shes dang // dam pa'i don dang kun rdzob dang // sbyor dang dkon mchog gsum po dang // thabs dang bcas pa'i rtogs pa dang // phyin ci log ni lam bcas dang // gnyen po mi mthun phyogs dag dang //
translated: The realization of the means,🔽The perversions together with the path,🔽The antidotes and the adverse,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni bsgom pa la //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni bsgom pa la //
translated: The characteristics and the cultivation,

original: smra ba rnams kyi log rtog pa //
analyzed: smra ba rnams kyi log rtog pa //
translated: The misconceptions of the teachers,

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid rten can //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid rten can //
translated: The basis of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa bcu drug dag tu bzhed //🔽ces bstan pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug dag tu bzhed // ces bstan pa la /
translated: Are accepted as being of sixteen kinds.

original: dbye ba bcu drug tu bzhed ces bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: dbye ba bcu drug tu bzhed ces bya ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning of “accepted as being of sixteen kinds” is taught.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rten pa'i dmigs pa 'thad pa la log par rtog pa ni gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yum shes par bya ba'i phyir de nyid nas brtsams te 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang dngos po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rten pa'i dmigs pa 'thad pa la log par rtog pa ni gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yum shes par bya ba'i phyir de nyid nas brtsams te 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyang dngos po med pa nyid do //
translated: Regarding that, the incorrect conception about the tenability of the object of observation that is based on the knowledge of all aspects is this: Someone thinks, “In order to know the mother of the knowledge of all aspects, one should begin with that and then know the compounded and uncompounded realms as non-things.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i ngo bo nyid med pas dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid med pas dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs la /
translated: Because they do not have the nature of that, they are non-things.

original: gzhan dag de la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'dri bar bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa lags zhes zhus pa gang yin pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag de la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'dri bar bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa lags zhes zhus pa gang yin pa la /
translated: Someone else asks, “Why is the knowledge of all aspects said to be a non-thing?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid med par bstan pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid med par bstan pas /
translated: The Bhagavān teaches that it is the non-existence of the nature of the past.

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po med @151a * //🔽pa'i ngo bo nyid de zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po med @151a * //🔽pa'i ngo bo nyid de zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: “All phenomena are non-things.”

original: mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid la log par rtog pa ni gang yang de rnams de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du med pa nyid dang / de lta yin na byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid la log par rtog pa ni gang yang de rnams de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du med pa nyid dang / de lta yin na byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nas /
translated: When that is so, there is the question: “From the practice of the perfections by the bodhisattva, up to the attainment of omniscience,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa med par zhus pa dang / rab 'byor chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa de nyid /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa med par zhus pa dang / rab 'byor chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa de nyid /
translated: Subhūti, that very knowledge of the nature of all dharmas as non-entities is the skillful means of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs la mkhas pa ste zhes bya ba de ni lan yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs la mkhas pa ste zhes bya ba de ni lan yin no //
translated: That is the answer.

original: yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa thob kyi bar du dus de srid du byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
analyzed: yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa thob kyi bar du dus de srid du byang chub kyi lam la yongs su 'dris par byed do //
translated: Moreover, for as long as the perfection of wisdom, etc., up to the attainment of the powers, fearlessnesses, etc., during that time the bodhisattva familiarizes with the path to enlightenment.

original: des pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: des pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: By that, the perfections are completed.

original: skad cig ma gcig dang yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par gyur nas /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig dang yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par gyur nas /
translated: and with the wisdom that is endowed with a single instant, they attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi skye bar spangs pas yongs su spong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi skye bar spangs pas yongs su spong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: And because they completely abandon all the afflictions that are connected with habitual tendencies by abandoning them without producing them again, they are purified.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la log par rtog pa ni gang de nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs pa na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la log par rtog pa ni gang de nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs pa na /
translated: As for the misconception about the knowledge of all aspects, when the Buddha looks with his buddha eye,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma gzigs pas /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma gzigs pas /
translated: he does not see things or nonthings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa spyad pa nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa spyad pa nas /
translated: Therefore, when they practice the perfections and so on,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i bar la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i bar la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: and when they practice in order to attain the knowledge of all aspects,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dngos po dang dngos po med par yid la mi byed do ;
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dngos po dang dngos po med par yid la mi byed do ;
translated: they do not pay attention to the perfections and so on as things or nonthings.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Because all phenomena are essentially insubstantial.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyis kyang dgongs shing yid la ma byas pa nyid kyis chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang mi 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyis kyang dgongs shing yid la ma byas pa nyid kyis chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang mi 'bral ba'o //
translated: And all the noble persons, by not attending to anything, are not separated from the dharmas themselves.

translated: The dharmas are the nature of non-substantiality in the dharmas, and the dharmas are to be known as non-substantial in the dharmas. In this way, by the method of the four alternatives,

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob nye bar bzung nas /🔽dngos po dngos po med ces bya bar ston par rjes su gnang ba'i phyir ro zhes rjes su bstan pa yin no //

original: sbyor ba la sogs par rtogs pa ni gang byang chub kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba la gzugs nas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams la spyod pa dang / rjes su spyod pa dag la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba la sogs par rtogs pa ni gang byang chub kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba la gzugs nas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams la spyod pa dang / rjes su spyod pa dag la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The realization of the practice, etc. is taught in the passage beginning with “the practice of enlightenment” and ending with “the practice and the subsequent practice are nondual and indivisible, which is the practice of enlightenment.”

original: sangs rgyas dkon mchog la log par rtog pa ni /🔽gang sangs rgyas zhes bya pa ni yang dag pa'i don brjod pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i chos la mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i don rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon bar rtogs pa'i go rims bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa gsum gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog la log par rtog pa ni / gang sangs rgyas zhes bya pa ni yang dag pa'i don brjod pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i chos la mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i don rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon bar rtogs pa'i go rims bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa gsum gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The misconception of the Jewel of the Buddha is🔽taught in the passage beginning with “the cause of the engagement of the expression of the perfect meaning” and ending with “the cause of the engagement of the expression of the Buddha.”🔽The perfect realization of the perfect Dharma and the perfect realization of the perfect meaning and the perfect realization of all phenomena just as they are are taught, respectively, in the passage beginning with “the cause of the engagement of the expression of the perfect Dharma” and ending with “the cause of the engagement of the expression of the perfect Dharma.”

original: sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The perfect realization of the perfect meaning is taught in the passage beginning with “the cause of the engagement of the expression of the perfect meaning” and ending with “the cause of the engagement of the expression of the perfect meaning.”🔽The perfect realization of all phenomena just as they are is taught in the passage beginning with “the cause of the engagement of the expression of the perfect realization of all phenomena just as they are” and ending with “the cause of the engagement of the expression of the perfect realization of all phenomena just as they are.”

original: chos dkon mchog la log par rtog pa ni gang byang chub ces bya ba'i tshig bla dags lus pa la /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog la log par rtog pa ni gang byang chub ces bya ba'i tshig bla dags lus pa la /
translated: The term “enlightenment” is a mere name,🔽the meaning of enlightenment is non-action,🔽enlightenment is suchness and so on,🔽enlightenment is mere name and sign,🔽enlightenment is the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa byang chub kyi tshig bla dags nyid yin pa dang / yang byang chub ni ming tsam nyid dang / yang mi byed pa'i don ni byang chub kyi don yin pa nyid dang / yang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa byang chub yin pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa byang chub kyi tshig bla dags nyid yin pa dang / yang byang chub ni ming tsam nyid dang / yang mi byed pa'i don ni byang chub kyi don yin pa nyid dang / yang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa byang chub yin pa dang /
translated: It is taught that the term “enlightenment” is an appellation for emptiness and so on,🔽enlightenment is a mere name,🔽the meaning of enlightenment is non-action,🔽enlightenment is suchness and so on,

original: yang ming dang mtshan ma tsam byang chub yin pa dang / yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub yin pa /
analyzed: yang ming dang mtshan ma tsam byang chub yin pa dang / yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub yin pa /
translated: enlightenment is mere name and sign,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na byang chub nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na byang chub nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and enlightenment is the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog la log par rtog pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nang byang chub la dmigs pa nyid bkag pa dang / de lta yin na pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa med na de nyid du gnyis kyi spyod pa spangs pa dang /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog la log par rtog pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nang byang chub la dmigs pa nyid bkag pa dang / de lta yin na pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa med na de nyid du gnyis kyi spyod pa spangs pa dang /
translated: And if that is so, if there is no grasping at the perfections, etc., then there is the abandonment of the conduct of the two.

original: de lta yin na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'i don du gnyis su med pa la brten pa 'phel bar bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gnyis su med par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'i don du gnyis su med pa la brten pa 'phel bar bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gnyis su med par spyod pa ni /
translated: And if that is so, then there is the teaching of the increase of the reliance on nonduality for the sake of the increase of the roots of virtue, and the irreversible Sangha is taught by the reply that the bodhisattva who practices nonduality🔽increases the roots of virtue

original: @152a * // dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel zhing /
analyzed: @152a * // dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel zhing /
translated: and is fearless.

original: mi 'jigs pa yin pa'i lan gyis phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun bstan pa'i don dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / gzungs rab tu thob pa dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang mi 'bral ba dang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa yin pa'i lan gyis phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun bstan pa'i don dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / gzungs rab tu thob pa dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang mi 'bral ba dang /
translated: And there is the teaching of the irreversible Sangha by the reply that the bodhisattva who practices nonduality🔽increases the roots of virtue🔽and is fearless.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because it is said that one attains omniscience.

original: thabs la mkhas ba la log par rtog pa ni gang de thob pa'i rgyu'i thabs la mkhas pa dang de bstan pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas ba la log par rtog pa ni gang de thob pa'i rgyu'i thabs la mkhas pa dang de bstan pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Misconception about skill in means is from the statement of the skill in means that is the cause of attaining that,🔽beginning with the teaching of that.

original: dang po sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas /🔽sangs rgyas la sogs pa la sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas / sangs rgyas la sogs pa la sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: one protects sentient beings by means of the skill in means that is endowed with the mental orientation of omniscience,🔽and by means of the skill in means that does not objectify the gift, the giver, and the receiver, one gives gifts to the Buddhas, etc.

original: sbyin par bya ba dang / gtong ba po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su skyob pa nyid dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la thabs la mkhas pa brjod par rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba dang / gtong ba po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su skyob pa nyid dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la thabs la mkhas pa brjod par rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And one should apply this to the skill in means of the perfections such as morality, etc.

original: de ltar thabs la mkhas pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin med par dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar thabs la mkhas pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin med par dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, skill in means is the very observation of all phenomena, such as form, as lacking intrinsic nature.

original: rnam par smin pa mi mdzad pas blo mchog dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mi mdzad pas blo mchog dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since it does not bring about karmic maturation, it is the very possession of the highest mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the nature of phenomena is nonexistence.

original: mngon bar rtogs pa la log par rtog pa ni gang dngos po med pas dngos pa med pa mngon bar byang chub bar bya bar mi nus pa nyid dang / dngos pos dngos po mngon par byang chub par mi nus pa nyid dang / dngos pos dngos po byang chub pa bkag pa dang /
analyzed: mngon bar rtogs pa la log par rtog pa ni gang dngos po med pas dngos pa med pa mngon bar byang chub bar bya bar mi nus pa nyid dang / dngos pos dngos po mngon par byang chub par mi nus pa nyid dang / dngos pos dngos po byang chub pa bkag pa dang /
translated: Misconception about realization is the inability to realize nonexistence through nonexistence, the inability to realize existence through existence, and the refutation of realizing existence through nonexistence.

original: de bzhin du dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pas dngos po med pa mngon bar byang chub par bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pas dngos po med pa mngon bar byang chub par bkag pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, it is the refutation of realizing nonexistence through existence, realizing nonexistence through nonexistence, and realizing existence through existence.

original: de lta na ni mngon bar rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas mu bzhi la go bzlog pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba ni /🔽mngon bar rtogs pa nyid yin par dam bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni mngon bar rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas mu bzhi la go bzlog pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba ni / mngon bar rtogs pa nyid yin par dam bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since the consequence would be that there would be no clear realization, the four possibilities are reversed.🔽The seeing of the equality of things and nonthings is the clear realization itself.

original: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu bsgom pa la mngon bar zhen pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu bsgom pa la mngon bar zhen pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas brtsams te /
translated: Likewise, it is to cling to the cultivation of the eight liberations and the nine serial steps of meditative absorption.🔽It is to cling to the fruits of entering the stream, and so forth, up to and including the transcendence of the enlightenment of the solitary buddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub las 'da' ba'i bar la mngon bar zhen pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la mngon bar zhen pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub las 'da' ba'i bar la mngon bar zhen pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la mngon bar zhen pa nas brtsams te /
translated: It is to cling to the complete perfection of the ten bodhisattva levels, up to and including the entry into the absence of faults.

original: skyon med par zhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang ; sems can yongs su smin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad bsgom pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: skyon med par zhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang ; sems can yongs su smin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad bsgom pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: It is to cling to the purification of a buddhafield, the maturation of sentient beings, the conduct of the six transcendent perfections, the cultivation of all aspects of emptiness, the powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bskyed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob pa dang / bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba la mngon par zhen pa ni spros pa nyid yin pa nyid du shes pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bskyed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob pa dang / bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba la mngon par zhen pa ni spros pa nyid yin pa nyid du shes pas /
translated: The conceptual elaboration of the generation of the powers, the acquisition of the knowledge of all aspects, and the abandonment of all afflictive emotions that are connected with habitual tendencies is itself conceptual elaboration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji skad du bshad pa'i spros pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji skad du bshad pa'i spros pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The bodhisattva is free from conceptual elaboration in the way that has been explained.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid la spros par mi byed la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid la spros par mi byed la /
translated: The nature of things does not elaborate on the nature of things.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa la spros par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gzugs la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa la spros par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gzugs la sogs pa ni /
translated: And non-entities do not elaborate on non-entities.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i spros pa med pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i spros pa med pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom, which is the non-elaboration of form and so on,🔽is approved as being without conceptual elaboration.

original: spros pa med par rjes su gnang ba dang / chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i lta bar zhugs pa la /
analyzed: spros pa med par rjes su gnang ba dang / chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i lta bar zhugs pa la /
translated: And in the view that all phenomena are without conceptual elaboration,

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar gzugs la yang ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar gzugs la yang ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because form is without an inherent nature, and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis na spros pa med par lta ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa dang / skyon med par rdzogs pas dngos po med pa nyid yin no /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis na spros pa med par lta ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa dang / skyon med par rdzogs pas dngos po med pa nyid yin no /
translated: It is the cause for seeing the absence of elaborations by nature and is the nonexistence of things by perfecting the faultless.

original: byang chub sems dpa' @153a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @153a * //
translated: The bodhisattva

original: skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i lam med pas /
analyzed: skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i lam med pas /
translated: does not enter the faultless path,

original: ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam dgra bcom pa'i dpes bstan pas lam shes pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med bar 'jug ba'i 'bras bu thob par bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam dgra bcom pa'i dpes bstan pas lam shes pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med bar 'jug ba'i 'bras bu thob par bstan pa yin la /
translated: and so the path of the result of non-arising and so on is taught by the example of the arhat. Thus it is taught that the bodhisattva attains the result of entering the faultless state through the knowledge of the path.

original: de nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Then, in a single instant immediately after the vajra-like concentration, one attains the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di'i mdo ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na dgra bcom pa ni lam thams cad la bslabs shing /
analyzed: 'di'i mdo ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na dgra bcom pa ni lam thams cad la bslabs shing /
translated: The sūtra on this is as follows: Subhūti, it is like this. For example, an arhat has trained in all the paths and has attained the result of arhatship.

original: yang dag pa'i skyon med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i skyon med par 'jug ste /
translated: He enters into the faultless,

original: nam 'bras bu'i lam ma grub kyi bar du thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: nam 'bras bu'i lam ma grub kyi bar du thob par mi byed do //
translated: but does not attain it until he has established the path of fruition.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang lam bsgrubs shing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang lam bsgrubs shing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug ste /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the path and enters into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva,

original: nam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: but does not attain the knowledge of all aspects until he has attained the vajra-like concentration.

original: lam la log par rtog pa ni gal te lam shes pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: lam la log par rtog pa ni gal te lam shes pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: As for the misconception about the path, if the knowledge of the path were completed,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug na brgyad pa la sogs pa'i lam ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug na brgyad pa la sogs pa'i lam ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and then one entered into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva, the eighth and other paths would be different.

original: lam de yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de 'bras bu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur bas brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lam de yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de 'bras bu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur bas brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva who completely perfects that path is on the eighth level, because he is about to realize its result and it would follow that he would be a stream enterer and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: From the time that the bodhisattva first generates the thought of enlightenment

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: until he practices the six perfections,

original: shes pa dang mthong ba dag gis dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa'i sa brgyad po las yongs su 'das nas /
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong ba dag gis dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa'i sa brgyad po las yongs su 'das nas /
translated: he transcends the eight levels such as the level of seeing what is virtuous and so on, by means of his knowledge and his vision.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas /
translated: Then, by means of the knowledge of the aspects of the path, he enters into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva and

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: obtains the gnosis of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: brgyad pa la sogs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang / spong ba dag ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang po kho nar nyan thos kyi lam gyis de'i rtogs pa @153b thob pa mngon du mi byed pa'i don gyis lam gyi rnam pa shes ba nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed🔽pa'i 'thad pas /
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang / spong ba dag ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang po kho nar nyan thos kyi lam gyis de'i rtogs pa @153b thob pa mngon du mi byed pa'i don gyis lam gyi rnam pa shes ba nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i 'thad pas /
translated: This is the meaning of “perfecting the knowledge of the aspects of the path.”

original: rim pa 'dis mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
translated: By this process, he fully awakens to perfect buddhahood,

original: 'bras bu ltar sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tshe bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sems can thams cad la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu nye bar 'tsho ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu ltar sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tshe bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sems can thams cad la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu nye bar 'tsho ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and like a fruit, he becomes the cause for all sentient beings to enjoy the fruit according to their fortune, which means that he becomes the cause for all sentient beings to enjoy the fruit of the harm they do.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam dang / tha dad pa'i bsam pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa'i lam la zhugs pas /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam dang / tha dad pa'i bsam pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa'i lam la zhugs pas /
translated: Engaged in the path of knowledge of the aspects of the path with a motivation different from that of the śrāvakas and so on,

original: lam thams cad kyi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing /
analyzed: lam thams cad kyi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing /
translated: One will fully awaken to buddhahood through the aspects, signs, and indications of all paths.

original: de gzhan dag la brjod pa dang / bstan pa la sogs pa ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi lam nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de gzhan dag la brjod pa dang / bstan pa la sogs pa ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi lam nyid yin pas /
translated: Since the teaching of those to others, the teaching, and so on are the path of the knowledge of the aspects of the path,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad go bar 'gyur ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i skad dang / brda bya ba'i sgra ni sgra brnyan dang 'dra bar shes par bya ba'i dgos pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad go bar 'gyur ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i skad dang / brda bya ba'i sgra ni sgra brnyan dang 'dra bar shes par bya ba'i dgos pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the language and symbolic sounds that are in accordance with the understanding of all sentient beings in the worlds of the great trichiliocosm are to be understood as being like an echo.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi thabs phun sum tshogs par shes par bya ba'i don dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi thabs phun sum tshogs par shes par bya ba'i don dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /

translated: The phrase thoroughly understood means that the son of good lineage has understood them well by means of analysis.

analyzed: skyes pa smos pa ni bud med kyang dgag pa yod pa ma yin te / sgra las skyes pa smos par bud med kyang sdud pa yin @154a * //
translated: The mention of males does not exclude females,

analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mention of males includes females.

original: dbang po de dag kyang dad pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po de dag kyang dad pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: And those faculties are faith and so forth.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang byang chub pa'i chos de dag ni ldan pa yang ma lags /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang byang chub pa'i chos de dag ni ldan pa yang ma lags /
translated: Those dharmas of the factors of awakening and the dharmas of awakening are not conjoined,

original: mi ldan pa yang ma lags /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma lags /
translated: they are not disjoined,

original: gzugs ma mchis pa /
analyzed: gzugs ma mchis pa /
translated: they are formless,

original: bstan du ma mchis pa /
analyzed: bstan du ma mchis pa /
translated: they cannot be pointed out,🔽they have one characteristic.🔽How can awakening be accomplished?

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa lags na ji ltar byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ba lags zhes zhus pa la sems can rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos mi shes pa de dag gi don du 'di skad du /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa lags na ji ltar byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ba lags zhes zhus pa la sems can rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos mi shes pa de dag gi don du 'di skad du /
translated: He asks this. For the sake of those sentient beings who do not understand the dharma that is empty of intrinsic characteristics, it is said:

original: 'di dag bdag gis bshad pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs la log par rtog pa ni gang rab 'byor de ni 'dir gzugs gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di dag bdag gis bshad pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs la log par rtog pa ni gang rab 'byor de ni 'dir gzugs gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: This is taught in order to understand what I have explained.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar gyi chos gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la ni ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar gyi chos gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la ni ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Misconception regarding the adverse side and the side of the antidote is as follows: Subhūti, whatever phenomena there are, beginning with “whatever form there is,” up to “the knowledge of all aspects,” all of them are not conjoined and are not disjoined with this noble discipline.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa nyid kyis sems can rnams gzung bar bya ba'i don du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis brjod do //
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa nyid kyis sems can rnams gzung bar bya ba'i don du 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis brjod do //
translated: They are expressed by worldly convention for the purpose of apprehending sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyis btags pa nyan thos dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa dang / mthong ba dag gis rtogs par mi bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de rnams kyis btags pa nyan thos dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes pa dang / mthong ba dag gis rtogs par mi bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid kyis so //
translated: They are not to be realized by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas who are designated by them, and they are to be realized by the knowledge and vision of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: They are not conjoined with desire,

original: bral ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: It is not associated with the three gateways to liberation, and it is not dissociated from them.🔽 It is not associated with the four summaries of the Dharma, and it is not dissociated from them.🔽 It is not associated with the four forms of exact knowledge, and it is not dissociated from them.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dul ba ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba nyid dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang ldan pa yang ma yin /🔽bral ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dul ba ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba nyid dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang ldan pa yang ma yin / bral ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: It is not associated with the four forms of analytical knowledge, and it is not dissociated from them.🔽 It is not associated with the eighteen distinct qualities of a buddha, and it is not dissociated from them.🔽 It is not associated with the ten powers of a tathāgata, and it is not dissociated from them.🔽 It is not associated with the four forms of intrepid confidence, and it is not dissociated from them.

original: rtogs pa'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is not associated with the four forms of exact knowledge, and it is not dissociated from them.

original: de ni 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad ni gzugs med pa /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad ni gzugs med pa /
translated: It is not associated with the four forms of purity, and it is not dissociated from them.🔽 It is not associated with the four forms of intrepid confidence, and it is not dissociated from them.

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: It is not associated with the four forms of unerring knowledge, and it is not dissociated from them.🔽 It is not associated with the eighteen distinct qualities of a buddha, and it is not dissociated from them.

original: thogs pa pa med pa /🔽'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /🔽de dag ni gzugs med pa dang / bstan du med pa la sogs pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / bstan du med pa la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig ldan pa dang bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i @154b 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //

translated: It is not associated with great loving kindness, and it

translated: The misconception of the definition is thinking that the form aggregate is not form.🔽

analyzed: bstan du med pa /

original: thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /

analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig par pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab nas /
translated: and of one characteristic,

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pas chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par bya ba yin na ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i las 'da' bar bya ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pas chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par bya ba yin na ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i las 'da' bar bya ba med par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa /
