original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: unobstructed,🔽and without characteristics by their very nature.

original: thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan nyid med pa la yang bslab par mi bya'o ;
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan nyid med pa la yang bslab par mi bya'o ;
translated: One should not train in the absence of characteristics.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽If something that was previously without characteristics were to become later endowed with characteristics, that would not be tenable.

original: gal te sngon mtshan nyid med par gyur pa de phyis mtshan nyid yod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid med par bslab pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sngon mtshan nyid med par gyur pa de phyis mtshan nyid yod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid med par bslab pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: Thus the training in characteristics and the absence of characteristics is refuted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether the Tathagatas arise or do not arise,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyibs 'di ni de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyibs 'di ni de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: this characteristicless form remains just as it is.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la log par rtog ni gang chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa yin na ni de bsgoms pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par mi 'thad pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i las 'das nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la log par rtog ni gang chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa yin na ni de bsgoms pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par mi 'thad pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i las 'das nas /
translated: The objection to the path of cultivation is this: If all phenomena are of one characteristic in being without characteristic, then it is not tenable that their cultivation is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.🔽Having transcended the stage of the Sravakas, etc.,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: one would not enter into the faultlessness of the Bodhisattvas, etc.

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / mtshan nyid tha dad pa gnyis ka bkag bas de ltar bsgom pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / mtshan nyid tha dad pa gnyis ka bkag bas de ltar bsgom pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The reply is: “The cultivation of that is without characteristic, because both the one characteristic and the different characteristics are negated.”

original: ji lta zhe na zhes bya ba ni zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na zhes bya ba ni zhus pa'o //
translated: How is that?

original: gzugs rnam par bsgom pa bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang / de'i 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs rnam par bsgom pa bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang / de'i 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: Similarly, it is the meditation on feeling and so on, the meditation on form and so on, the meditation on eye consciousness and so on, the meditation on the contact and so on of those,

original: de'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams drug dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / de'i yan lag mya ngan la sogs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / spang ba'i mtshan nyid blang ba @155a * //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams drug dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / de'i yan lag mya ngan la sogs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / spang ba'i mtshan nyid blang ba @155a * //
translated: the meditation on the feeling and so on that arise from those conditions, the meditation on the six elements such as earth, the meditation on dependent origination, the meditation on the branches of that such as sorrow, the meditation on the characteristics of the practice of adopting and rejecting,

original: dang ; dor ba dang / dang po la sogs pa'i bsam gtan rnams dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rjes su dran pa drug nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dang ; dor ba dang / dang po la sogs pa'i bsam gtan rnams dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rjes su dran pa drug nas bzung ste /
translated: the meditation on the first concentration and so on, the meditation on love, compassion, joy, equanimity, the formless absorptions, the six recollections,

original: thabs rjes su dran pa rnams dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag dang / sems can la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang /
analyzed: thabs rjes su dran pa rnams dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag dang / sems can la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang /
translated: the mindfulness of the method, the perception of impermanence, suffering, and no-self, the perception of self, sentient beings, and so forth, the perception of permanence, impermanence, happiness,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba'i 'du shes dang / dran ba nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba'i 'du shes dang / dran ba nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: suffering, peace, and not peace, the close mindfulnesses, and so forth, the factors of enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: rnam pa thar pa brgya dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: rnam pa thar pa brgya dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: the hundred doors of liberation, the nine serial absorptions, and the conceptual

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang ; rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa yang med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang ; rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa yang med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang /
translated: concentration with investigation and analysis, concentration without investigation but with analysis, concentration without investigation and without analysis, the four noble truths of suffering, origin, cessation,

original: lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ; kun rdzob dang / 'dris pa dang / sgra ji bzhin shes pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang /
analyzed: lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ; kun rdzob dang / 'dris pa dang / sgra ji bzhin shes pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang /
translated: and the path, the knowledge of exhaustion and the knowledge of nonarising, the knowledge of phenomena, subsequent knowledge, conventional knowledge, familiar knowledge, literal knowledge, the perfections, all the emptinesses,

original: mngon bar shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad dang /
analyzed: mngon bar shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad dang /
translated: the higher cognitions, the concentrations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the distinct attributes of a buddha, all the dhāraṇīs and the gateways to concentration,

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa bsgom pa rnam par bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa bsgom pa rnam par bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nyid yin no //
translated: The cultivation of the great love, the great compassion, the fruit of stream-entry, etc., the enlightenment of a Solitary Buddha, the knowledge of all modes, and the relinquishment of all the defilements together with their residues, is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsgom pa smos pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa'i dbang @155b du mdzad pa'i phyir /🔽ji skad du bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa smos pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa'i dbang @155b du mdzad pa'i phyir / ji skad du bstan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of cultivation is for the sake of the brief and extensive clear realizations of the three knowledges.🔽The mention of the path of cultivation is for the sake of knowing the path of cultivation as it has been taught.

original: rnam par bsgom pa smos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin shes par bya ba'i ched du yin no //
analyzed: rnam par bsgom pa smos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin shes par bya ba'i ched du yin no //
translated: The mention of cultivation is for the sake of knowing the path of cultivation as it is.

original: gzugs la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba mang po smos pa ni sngar bsgom pa'i lam gyi yul du shes par bya ba'i ched yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba mang po smos pa ni sngar bsgom pa'i lam gyi yul du shes par bya ba'i ched yin no //
translated: The many divisions of the general characteristics of form, etc., and of their individual characteristics are mentioned for the sake of knowing the objects of the path of meditation.🔽How?

original: ji lta zhe na zhes dris pa la ji skad du bshad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bag chags la sogs pa'i bsgom pa med pa yin pas dngos po med pa rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na zhes dris pa la ji skad du bshad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bag chags la sogs pa'i bsgom pa med pa yin pas dngos po med pa rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
translated: The non-existence of the meditation of the counteragents to that knowledge of all aspects, beginning with form, is taught extensively.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor dngos po'i 'dus shes can la shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor dngos po'i 'dus shes can la shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa med do //
translated: Subhuti, there is no meditation of the perfection of knowledge in the realm of entities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji ltar dngos po la ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po la ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas so //
translated: Because of the attachment to the two extremes in regard to entities, thinking self.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs thams cad bsgom pa med pa la dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid zhus pa la /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs thams cad bsgom pa med pa la dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid zhus pa la /
translated: In the absence of cultivating all the aspects of the antidote, he asks about the characteristics of existence and non-existence.

original: gnyis po de dag la ni gnyis kyi mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa dang / gnyis dang gnyis ma yin pa zhus pa dang / gzugs kyi 'du shes nas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes kyi bar du go rims bzhin du gnyis dang gnyis med pa bstan nas /
analyzed: gnyis po de dag la ni gnyis kyi mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa dang / gnyis dang gnyis ma yin pa zhus pa dang / gzugs kyi 'du shes nas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes kyi bar du go rims bzhin du gnyis dang gnyis med pa bstan nas /
translated: In response to that, the characteristics of both are taught, and he asks about both and not both. The characteristics of both and not both are taught in order, from the perception of form up to the perception of the compounded and uncompounded elements.

original: ji tsam du gnyis pa de tsam dud ngos po'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du gnyis pa de tsam dud ngos po'o //
translated: To the extent there is duality, to that extent there is existence.

original: ji tsam dud ngos po yod pa de tsam du 'dus byas so //
analyzed: ji tsam dud ngos po yod pa de tsam du 'dus byas so //
translated: To the extent there is existence, to that extent there is the compounded.

original: ji tsam du 'dus byas pa de tsam du sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba can gyi sdug bsngal las mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: ji tsam du 'dus byas pa de tsam du sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba can gyi sdug bsngal las mi 'grol lo //
translated: To the extent there is the compounded, to that extent sentient beings are not liberated from the suffering of the roots of virtue.

original: gnyis kyi 'du shes can ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad med do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi 'du shes can ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad med do //
translated: One who has the perception of duality does not have generosity and so forth, all the purifying dharmas.

original: gal te de lta yin na dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad med par 'gyur bas ;
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad med par 'gyur bas ;
translated: If that were so, then for one who has the notion of non-entityness, all the dharmas of purification would not exist.

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is just so.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te zhes zhal gyis bzhes nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa byang chub sems dpa' ni dngos po thams cad yod pa dang med pa'i 'du shes bkag pas mthun pa'i bzod pa'i lam dang / 'bras bu bstan pas lam dang @156a * //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te zhes zhal gyis bzhes nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa byang chub sems dpa' ni dngos po thams cad yod pa dang med pa'i 'du shes bkag pas mthun pa'i bzod pa'i lam dang / 'bras bu bstan pas lam dang @156a * //
translated: Having assented to what was said, “It is just as you have said,” he taught the path of acquiescence in accordance with the perfection of wisdom, and the path of the result, by means of the non-existence of all entities.

original: dngos por rtog pa med pa nyid kyi rnam grangs kyi chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: dngos por rtog pa med pa nyid kyi rnam grangs kyi chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: Since all dharmas are synonyms for non-entityness,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i chos med par shes par byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i chos med par shes par byed pa'i don yin no //
translated: the meaning is that one should understand that the gnosis of realization is not a dharma that is separate from its object.

original: gal te de lta yin na de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad la mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad la mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: If that were so, then after the Tathāgata fully awakened to all dharmas,

original: de la dbang bsgyur ba'i yul brnyes pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la dbang bsgyur ba'i yul brnyes pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it follows that there is no attainment of the object of mastery, etc.,

original: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod pa na pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod pa na pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: in the past, when he was practicing the bodhisattva way of life, he practiced the six perfections.

original: 'dod pa rnams las dben sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las dben sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: He attained the first concentration, which is free from the desires, free from evil and nonvirtuous things,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with applied thought and with sustained thought,🔽born of solitude,🔽and abided in it.🔽He attained the second concentration, which is free from applied thought and sustained thought,🔽born of concentration, and abided in it.🔽He attained the third concentration, which is full of one-pointed mindfulness and equanimity, and abided in it.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽sems can rnams phung po gsum du lung bstan par gyur to zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / sems can rnams phung po gsum du lung bstan par gyur to zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: He attained the fourth concentration, which is free from joy, free from suffering, free from happiness, and free from unhappiness, and abided in it.🔽He attained the sphere of the infinity of space, and abided in it.🔽He attained the sphere of the infinity of consciousness, and abided in it.🔽He attained the sphere of nothingness, and abided in it.🔽He attained the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception, and abided in it.🔽He attained the cessation of perception and feeling, and abided in it.

original: nga nyid dbang du gyur pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid thugs su chud pa'i chos bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nga nyid dbang du gyur pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid thugs su chud pa'i chos bstan pa yin no //
translated: He attained the knowledge of the three knowledges, the four fearlessnesses, the four analytical knowledges, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha.🔽He attained the knowledge of all aspects, and abided in it.🔽He attained the knowledge of the path, and abided in it.🔽He attained the knowledge of the bases, and abided in it.🔽He attained the knowledge of the aspects, and abided in it.🔽He attained the knowledge of the aspects of the path, and abided in it.🔽He attained the knowledge of the aspects of the bases, and abided in it.🔽He attained the knowledge of the aspects of the path and the bases, and abided in it.🔽He attained the knowledge of the aspects of the path and the bases, and abided in it.🔽He attained the knowledge of the aspects of the path, the bases, and the aspects, and abided in it.🔽He attained the knowledge of the aspects of the path, the bases, and the aspects, and abided in it.🔽He attained the knowledge of the aspects of the path, the bases, the aspects, and the aspects of the path, and abided in it.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rnam pa thugs su chud par zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rnam pa thugs su chud par zhes pa'o //
translated: He attained the knowledge of the aspects

original: rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa rnams la sogs pa dngos po zhig yod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa rnams la sogs pa dngos po zhig yod de /
translated: Subhūti, if the things such as the sense-objects were to exist,

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa'am zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa'am zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning with “if they had an intrinsic reality,”

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i thugs su chud pa bstan pa yin no //🔽de la dngos po ni gang gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i thugs su chud pa bstan pa yin no // de la dngos po ni gang gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni bya ba'o //
translated: then the teaching of the realization of the intended meaning would not be tenable.

original: med pa ni dngos po'i rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ni dngos po'i rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: Here, “thing” is the intrinsic reality of something, and “non-thing” is the cessation of the continuum of a thing.

original: de ltar 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten du byas nas rab tu smra ba rnams kyi ma nges pa dang bcas pa'i skabs rgyas par 'phros pa'i log par bsgrub pa'i gnas rnam pa bcu drug tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten du byas nas rab tu smra ba rnams kyi ma nges pa dang bcas pa'i skabs rgyas par 'phros pa'i log par bsgrub pa'i gnas rnam pa bcu drug tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these sixteen types of arguments are the extensive elaboration of the uncertain points of the proponents, taking the knowledge of all aspects as the basis.

original: de ltar byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas /
translated: Having done that,🔽the signs of that, its development,🔽its stability, the abiding of the mind,

original: de yi rtags dang rnam 'phel dang // brtan dang sems kun gnas pa dang // mthong zhes bya dang bsgom pa zhes //
analyzed: de yi rtags dang rnam 'phel dang // brtan dang sems kun gnas pa dang // mthong zhes bya dang bsgom pa zhes //
translated: and what is called “seeing” and “cultivation”

original: bya ba'i lam ni so so la //
analyzed: bya ba'i lam ni so so la //
translated: are the paths of action for each one.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //
translated: The four types of conceptualization

original: gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
translated: And the four kinds of antidotes.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The concentration without obstacles,

original: log par bsgrub dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: log par bsgrub dang bcas pa ni //
translated: And with the wrong practice,🔽Is taught as the realization of the peak.

original: rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs zhes bstan pa de bshad pa yin par shes @156b par bya'o //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs zhes bstan pa de bshad pa yin par shes @156b par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the explanation.

original: mngon bar rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'o /
analyzed: mngon bar rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'o /
translated: In the treatise of instructions on the perfection of wisdom called Ornament of Clear Realization, this is the realization of the peak.

original: // / da ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the realization of the serial is to be explained.

original: gal te de ltar rtogs pa'i chos ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rtogs pa'i chos ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: If the Dharma realized in that way is the nature of non-entityness,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na mthar gyis spyod pa dang / mthar gyis slob pa dang / mthar gyis nan tan du bgyi bar 'tshal zhing zhes zhus pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na mthar gyis spyod pa dang / mthar gyis slob pa dang / mthar gyis nan tan du bgyi bar 'tshal zhing zhes zhus pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: then the question is asked, Blessed One, how should one practice the perfection of wisdom, practicing in sequence, training in sequence, and practicing earnestly in sequence?

original: mthar gyis pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa nye bar dgongs pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa nye bar dgongs pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the order of the realizations is that of the serial one.

original: de la sems bskyed pa shes par bya ba'i don du spyod pa smos so //🔽nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa shes par bya ba'i don du spyod pa smos so // nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa /
translated: In this regard, the word “practice” is mentioned for the purpose of understanding the generation of the thought.🔽The word “stages” is mentioned for the purpose of understanding the aids to penetration.

original: shes par bya ba'i don du ni bslab pa smos so //
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i don du ni bslab pa smos so //
translated: The word “training” is mentioned for the purpose of understanding the knowable.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam shes pa'i don ni nan tan du bya ba smos so //🔽mngon bar rtogs pa'i go rims shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam shes pa'i don ni nan tan du bya ba smos so // mngon bar rtogs pa'i go rims shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The word “practice” is mentioned for the purpose of understanding the path of insight and the path of cultivation.

original: gsum char smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum char smos pa yin no //
translated: All three are mentioned for the purpose of understanding the order of the realizations.

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos thog mar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang zhes bya ba rnams brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos thog mar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang zhes bya ba rnams brtsams te /
translated: Subhuti, thus should a Bodhisattva, a great being, first of all, in the presence of the Buddhas, the Lords,

original: gal te bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang rung ma rgyas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang rung ma rgyas kyang rung ste /
translated: “Whether I shall fully know the supreme enlightenment or not,

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid kyis zhes nges par bzung ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid kyis zhes nges par bzung ba la /
translated: The phrase by the unreality of all things is a specification.

original: sems can dngos po'i 'du shes can la spyod pa thams cad de las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can dngos po'i 'du shes can la spyod pa thams cad de las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to turn sentient beings away from the notion of real things and from all conduct based on that notion,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug cing mthar gyis spyod pa la sogs pa brtson par bstan pas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug cing mthar gyis spyod pa la sogs pa brtson par bstan pas /
translated: the method of engaging in the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and of striving in the practices, etc.,🔽is indicated.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i go rims kyis gzhan gyi don bya ba'i thabs yin bar brdar byas pa'i dngos po'i dngos po shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i go rims kyis gzhan gyi don bya ba'i thabs yin bar brdar byas pa'i dngos po'i dngos po shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught in order to make known the real thing that is indicated by the term method of accomplishing the welfare of others by the order of realization.

original: mthar gyis pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa de yang rnam pa bcu gsum du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa de yang rnam pa bcu gsum du shes par bya'o //
translated: That gradual realization should be understood as having thirteen aspects.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?🔽From generosity up to wisdom,🔽and mindfulness of the Buddha, etc.,

original: sbyin dang shes rab bar dag dang // sangs rgyas la sogs dran dang chos //
analyzed: sbyin dang shes rab bar dag dang // sangs rgyas la sogs dran dang chos //
translated: and the Dharma,

original: dngos med ngo bo nyid kyis te //🔽mthar gyis pa yi bya bar bzhed //
analyzed: dngos med ngo bo nyid kyis te // mthar gyis pa yi bya bar bzhed //
translated: by the nature of unreality,

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: are considered the practices of the gradualist.

original: de la @157a * //
analyzed: de la @157a * //
translated: The first of these is as follows.🔽

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa ni /
translated: The realization of the perfection of generosity is as follows:

original: gang de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon bar spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon bar spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When one practices the perfection of generosity,

original: bdag kyang sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag kyang sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning with “when I give gifts,”

original: sbyin pa mthar gyis spyod pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa shes pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa mthar gyis spyod pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa shes pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that one engages in the practice of generosity in stages through knowing.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang bdag kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang bdag kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The perfection of morality is as follows: beginning with “I will practice the perfection of morality,”

original: tshul khrims kyis mthar gyis spyod pa la 'jug pa la sogs pa la shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis mthar gyis spyod pa la 'jug pa la sogs pa la shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that one engages in the practice of morality in stages through knowing.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang bdag kyang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang bdag kyang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The perfection of patience is as follows: beginning with “I will practice the perfection of patience,”

original: bzod pas mthar gyis spyod pa'i shes pa la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab ste /
analyzed: bzod pas mthar gyis spyod pa'i shes pa la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab ste /
translated: And likewise, by means of effort, meditation, and wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa re re zhing mthar gyis pa'i rnam par 'phel bar re res mthar gyis pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa re re zhing mthar gyis pa'i rnam par 'phel bar re res mthar gyis pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that each of the practices of the perfections has its own gradual increase, and each has its own gradual realization.🔽The realization of the recollection of the Buddha is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa ni gang yang de sems dang po bskyed pa nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa ni gang yang de sems dang po bskyed pa nyid kyi tshe /
translated: From the very first production of the thought of enlightenment,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /
translated: one has the mental activity associated with the knowledge of all things.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du lhag par mos shing /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du lhag par mos shing /
translated: One has the superior understanding that all things are of the nature of unreality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs kyi sku la sogs par byed pa la mi byed pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs kyi sku la sogs par byed pa la mi byed pas /
translated: One does not conceive of the Tathāgata as form, etc.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa med pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa med pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The non-recollection of the Buddha is the recollection of the Buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la ngo bo nyid med pas dngos po med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la ngo bo nyid med pas dngos po med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Form is not a thing because it has no intrinsic reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽The recollection of the Buddha is the absence of recollection and the absence of mental activity.

original: dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du re re zhing rgyu'i drug pa'i sbyor ba gnyis yin no //
analyzed: dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du re re zhing rgyu'i drug pa'i sbyor ba gnyis yin no //
translated: Each of these is a twofold application of the six causes.🔽The recollection of the Buddha is the absence of mental activity with regard to the major and minor marks, etc.🔽The recollection of the Dharma is the absence of mental activity with regard to the aggregate of morality, etc.🔽The recollection of the Saṅgha is the absence of mental activity with regard to the four pairs of individuals, etc.

original: de ni mtshan dang dpe byad pa la sogs pa'i yid la mi byed pa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang ; de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa yid la mi byed pas de rjes su dran pa dang / de bzhin du stobs bcu la sogs pa yid la mi byed pas de rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: de ni mtshan dang dpe byad pa la sogs pa'i yid la mi byed pa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang ; de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa yid la mi byed pas de rjes su dran pa dang / de bzhin du stobs bcu la sogs pa yid la mi byed pas de rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: The recollection of the constituents of enlightenment is the absence of mental activity with regard to the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.🔽The recollection of the holy truths is the absence of mental activity with regard to the four noble truths.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yid la mi byed pas /
translated: The recollection of dependent origination is the absence of mental activity with regard to the twelve members of dependent origination.

original: de rjes su dran pa zhes bstan pa'i @157b sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rnam pa lngas de bshad pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de rjes su dran pa zhes bstan pa'i @157b sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rnam pa lngas de bshad pa byas pa yin no //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha is taught as the absence of mental activity with regard to the five aggregates of the Buddha.

original: de la dang pos ni sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The first of these is the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: lhag ma bzhis ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhis yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma bzhis ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhis yin te /
translated: The remaining four are the four aspects of the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de ltar bslabs shing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: de ltar bslabs shing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: Thus, having trained and perfected the factors of enlightenment such as the close mindfulness,

original: mthong ba'i lam nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: from the path of seeing up to the gnosis of omniscience is called the path of meditation.

original: de ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yod du zin kyang thar pa'i spyod pa la sogs pa rab tu shes pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yod du zin kyang thar pa'i spyod pa la sogs pa rab tu shes pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, although the nature of nonentity exists, the cultivation of the mindfulness of the Buddha should be understood as the thorough knowledge of the conduct of liberation and so on.

original: de bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung ma bstan la sogs pa'i chos yid la mi byed pa ni chos rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung ma bstan la sogs pa'i chos yid la mi byed pa ni chos rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Similarly, not attending to virtuous, nonvirtuous, neutral, and so on phenomena is the mindfulness of phenomena.

original: skyes bu zung bzhi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rab tu bsgoms pas dngos po med pa nyid du yid la byed pas rjes su dran pa yid la bya ba med pa ni dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu zung bzhi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rab tu bsgoms pas dngos po med pa nyid du yid la byed pas rjes su dran pa yid la bya ba med pa ni dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of the Saṅgha is the non-attention to the non-existence of the four pairs of persons, by the non-attention to the mental attention to the non-existence of the four pairs of persons, through the thorough cultivation of the nature of the non-existence of the four pairs of persons.

original: dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment🔽up to the seat of enlightenment,

original: ma ral ba dang / ma zhig pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / skyon med pa dang / ma nyams pa /
analyzed: ma ral ba dang / ma zhig pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / skyon med pa dang / ma nyams pa /
translated: the morality of the bodhisattva is unbroken, uncorrupted, unadulterated, flawless, unblemished,

original: mthu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mthu dang ldan pa /
translated: powerful,

original: mkhas pas bsngags pa /
analyzed: mkhas pas bsngags pa /
translated: praised by the wise,

original: shin tu rtogs pa ting nge 'dzin yongs su bsgrub pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa ting nge 'dzin yongs su bsgrub pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa yin te /
translated: and well-cultivated.

original: de tshul khrims de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed pa'i rjes su dran pa'i yid la mi byed pa ni tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: de tshul khrims de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed pa'i rjes su dran pa'i yid la mi byed pa ni tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of morality is the non-attention to the mental attention to that morality as the nature of non-existence, by the non-attention to the mental attention to that morality as the nature of non-existence.

original: de la theg pa gzhan la mi rten pa nyid kyis na ma ral pa'o //
analyzed: de la theg pa gzhan la mi rten pa nyid kyis na ma ral pa'o //
translated: Therein, it is unbroken because it is not based on other vehicles.

original: yang srid par skye ba rnam par spangs pas rnam par ma zhig pa'o //
analyzed: yang srid par skye ba rnam par spangs pas rnam par ma zhig pa'o //
translated: It is uncorrupted because it is free from the corruption of rebirth.

original: skye bo ngan pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / ma 'dres pa nyid kyis rnam 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo ngan pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / ma 'dres pa nyid kyis rnam 'dres pa'o //
translated: It is unadulterated, because it is not adulterated with evil people, addictions, or bad states.

original: dkar po'i chos kyi cha gcig tu rnam par 'phel ba na skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos kyi cha gcig tu rnam par 'phel ba na skyon med pa'o //
translated: It is faultless, because it increases the side of virtue.

original: skye bar smon lam mi 'debs pa nyid kyis na ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: skye bar smon lam mi 'debs pa nyid kyis na ma nyams pa'o //
translated: It is not damaged, because it does not make prayers for rebirth.

original: ji ltar 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid kyis na mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid kyis na mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is powerful, because it goes wherever it wishes.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pas na mkhas pas bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pas na mkhas pas bsngags pa'o //
translated: It is praised by the wise, because it is not condemned by the wise.

original: dbang po rnam bsangs pas na shin tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnam bsangs pas na shin tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is well-penetrated, because it is well-purified of the obscurations of the sensory domains.

original: bsam gtan gyi yan lag gi tshogs rgyas pa nyid kyis na ting nge 'dzin yongs su bsgrub @158a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi yan lag gi tshogs rgyas pa nyid kyis na ting nge 'dzin yongs su bsgrub @158a * //
translated: It is the accomplishment of concentration, because it is the expansion of the collection of factors of enlightenment.

original: pa'o ; / chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa bdag la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed pas rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa med pa ni gtong ba rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa bdag la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed pas rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa med pa ni gtong ba rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of giving is the attention to the absence of attention to the fact that the giving of Dharma and material things is insubstantial.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba dag dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed pas rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa med pa ni lha rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba dag dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed pas rjes su dran pa yid la byed pa med pa ni lha rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: The recollection of gods is the attention that is not the attention of recollection, because those who have entered the stream and the nonreturners who are born in the six classes of gods in the desire realm and in the form and formless realms, by taking the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature to mind.

original: mthar gyis pa'i spyod pa la sogs pa shes pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i spyod pa la sogs pa shes pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: gal te de lta yin na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: mdo sde gzhan las lha'i ris gnyis rjes su dran par byas te /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las lha'i ris gnyis rjes su dran par byas te /
translated: how is the recollection of two classes of gods to be interpreted in another sutra,🔽which says:

original: dga' ldan dang / gtsang ma'o zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ldan dang / gtsang ma'o zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: “The Tuṣita gods and the Śuddhāvāsa gods”?

original: de ni ma 'dres pa'i gang zag la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de ni ma 'dres pa'i gang zag la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because that was said intending a person who is not a mixture of the two.

original: chos rnams la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pas mthar gyis pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: chos rnams la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pas mthar gyis pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa ni /
translated: The realization of the serial is the knowledge that phenomena are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang /
translated: Thus, it is taught that when bodhisattvas train in the six perfections, all the emptinesses, the factors of awakening, the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / mngon bar shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / stobs dang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / mngon bar shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / stobs dang /
translated: the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, the doors of retention, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa dang / snying rje chen po la slob pa na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mthar gyis spyod pa la sogs pa shes pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa dang / snying rje chen po la slob pa na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mthar gyis spyod pa la sogs pa shes pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: the fearlessnesses, and so forth, and great compassion, they do so by way of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature. It is taught that they do so by knowing the stages of the path and so forth by way of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na ni gang thams cad med pa'i phyir gcig tu chad par smra bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo bo nyid la yod pa'am /🔽med pa mi dmigs par de'i lan gsungs pa dang / rang nyid la ne ma nur med kyang ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba la ltos nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis zhus pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na ni sems can rnams kyi don gyi slad du /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na ni gang thams cad med pa'i phyir gcig tu chad par smra bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo bo nyid la yod pa'am / med pa mi dmigs par de'i lan gsungs pa dang / rang nyid la ne ma nur med kyang ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba la ltos nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis zhus pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na ni sems can rnams kyi don gyi slad du /
translated: The reply is that in the essence of the unreality of all phenomena, existence and nonexistence are not observed,🔽and although the elder Subhūti himself has no doubts, he asks in consideration of future generations.

original: bla na med @158b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa med pa zhe na /
analyzed: bla na med @158b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa med pa zhe na /
translated: If all phenomena are essentially unreal, then it would follow that one would not enter into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la thob pa dang mngon bar zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la thob pa dang mngon bar zhe na /
translated: For one who has the perception of an object, there is attainment and pride.

original: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la thob pa dang mngon bar rtogs pa bkag pa dang mi dmigs pa nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings 'khrugs pa med pa dang / de thob pa dang mngon bar rtogs pa nyid yin pa dang / de lta yin na sa bcu la sogs pa gzhag pa med pa dang /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la thob pa dang mngon bar rtogs pa bkag pa dang mi dmigs pa nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings 'khrugs pa med pa dang / de thob pa dang mngon bar rtogs pa nyid yin pa dang / de lta yin na sa bcu la sogs pa gzhag pa med pa dang /
translated: And if that is so, the ten grounds and so forth are not established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mngon bar 'dod pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang / ma dmigs pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa tha dad du bya ba bkag pa dang / de mi dmigs par sgom par byed pa'i khyad par shes pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mngon bar 'dod pa yang dag par 'grub pa dang / ma dmigs pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa tha dad du bya ba bkag pa dang / de mi dmigs par sgom par byed pa'i khyad par shes pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the perfect accomplishment of what is desired, the refutation of the differentiation of generosity and so forth in non-objectification, and the knowledge of the distinction of cultivating non-objectification, are due to the very fact of fully and completely awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de de ltar byas na /
analyzed: de de ltar byas na /
translated: When it is done in that way,

original: mthar gyis pa /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa /
translated: the gradualist,

original: rnam gsum rnam bcu zhes bstan pa de 'thad ba dang bcas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam gsum rnam bcu zhes bstan pa de 'thad ba dang bcas par shes par bya'o //
translated: the one with three and ten aspects, should be understood as being reasonable.

original: mngon bar rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las /
analyzed: mngon bar rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las /
translated: The Ornament of Clear Realization is a treatise on the perfection of wisdom that is an instruction on clear realization.

original: mthar gyis pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i mngon bar rtogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is a commentary on the clear realization that is step by step.

original: // / da ni sems kyi skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brjod par bya ste /🔽gang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: // / da ni sems kyi skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brjod par bya ste / gang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Now, the clear realization in a single instant will be explained.

original: sems bskyed pa gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su 'dzin pa lags zhes zhus pas /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su 'dzin pa lags zhes zhus pas /
translated: When the Bhagavān was asked, “When bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, in a single production of the thought, how do they embrace the six perfections?”

original: skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par rtogs par nye bar bkod pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par rtogs par nye bar bkod pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: he taught that it is by the meaning of the arrangement of the clear realization in a single instant.

original: skad cig ma gcig gi mngon bar byang chub pa de yang rnam pa bzhir shes par bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gi mngon bar byang chub pa de yang rnam pa bzhir shes par bya ste /
translated: That clear realization in a single instant should be understood as having four aspects.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa gang yang rung ba'i zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig gis bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa gang yang rung ba'i zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig gis bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In terms of the defining characteristics of all uncontaminated phenomena, such as generosity, subsumed in a single moment,🔽it is taught:

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa re res kyang //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa re res kyang //
translated: Because each of generosity and so on

original: zag med chos kun bsdus pa'i phyir //🔽thub pa'i skad cig gcig pa yi //
analyzed: zag med chos kun bsdus pa'i phyir // thub pa'i skad cig gcig pa yi //
translated: subsumes all uncontaminated phenomena,🔽this realization of the Sage

original: rtogs pa 'di ni shes par bya //🔽zhes bstan pas ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su @159a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di ni shes par bya // zhes bstan pas ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su @159a * //
translated: in a single moment should be understood.

original: zin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
analyzed: zin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
translated: This teaches that the perfection of generosity and so on, embraced by the perfection of wisdom,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i 'du shes ni skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i 'du shes ni skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: subsumes the eighty minor marks and so on, because they are fully completed in a single moment without dualistic perception.

original: dkar po'i chos thams cad khongs su 'dus pa nyid kyis zag pa med pa'i chos la gnas pa ni ci zhig gis sbyin par bya zhes mtshan ma de mi mthong bar sbyin pa gtong ba ni /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos thams cad khongs su 'dus pa nyid kyis zag pa med pa'i chos la gnas pa ni ci zhig gis sbyin par bya zhes mtshan ma de mi mthong bar sbyin pa gtong ba ni /
translated: Since all virtuous qualities are included in it, one gives without seeing any sign of what is to be given, by whom it is to be given, to whom it is to be given, or to whom it is to be given, since one abides in the uncontaminated Dharma.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i rnam pas skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs pa nyid yin pa dang / de lta yin na mtshan ma med pa dang / mngon bar 'dus ma byas pa la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i rnam pas skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs pa nyid yin pa dang / de lta yin na mtshan ma med pa dang / mngon bar 'dus ma byas pa la sogs pas ni /
translated: It is the realization of the single instant, in the manner of the non-observation of all phenomena.🔽If that were the case, it would follow that the perfections and so forth would not be completed by the signless, the unconditioned, and so forth.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / khyed kyi sbyin pa de ltar phan pa med pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / khyed kyi sbyin pa de ltar phan pa med pa /
translated: Your generosity is thus useless.

original: mi brten pa des ci zhig bya zhes zer na zhes bya ba slu ba yin du zin kyang mi dmigs par yongs su bsngo ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa las yongs su ldog par mi byed par ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi dpes pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs par gsungs pas de'i lan btab pa dang /
analyzed: mi brten pa des ci zhig bya zhes zer na zhes bya ba slu ba yin du zin kyang mi dmigs par yongs su bsngo ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa las yongs su ldog par mi byed par ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi dpes pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs par gsungs pas de'i lan btab pa dang /
translated: The example of the gods of the Paranirmita-vasavartin realm is stated to complete the side of purification, such as all the perfections.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rgya cher mdo ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rgya cher mdo ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should extensively explain the perfections of morality and so on, just as they are in the sutras.

original: 'di'i mdo ni /
analyzed: 'di'i mdo ni /
translated: The sutra says:

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /

analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i yo byad phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni bsams pa tsam gyis 'byung ngo //
translated: All the perfect resources of the gods of the Paranirmita-vasavartin realm arise merely through thought.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yo byad phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyang bsams pa tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yo byad phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyang bsams pa tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, all the perfect resources of the bodhisattva mahāsattva arise merely through thought, and the perfections are completed.

original: yang ji ltar na zag pa med pa'i chos gcig dmigs nas bsgom pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad sdud pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na zag pa med pa'i chos gcig dmigs nas bsgom pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad sdud pa yin zhe na /
translated: And how, having observed one uncontaminated dharma, is the cultivation of all uncontaminated dharmas included?

original: don 'di la 'jig rten pa'i dpe byad kyang re zhig bstan dgos so //
analyzed: don 'di la 'jig rten pa'i dpe byad kyang re zhig bstan dgos so //
translated: In this matter, even worldly examples must be taught.

original: ji ltar skyes bus zo chun brgyud //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bus zo chun brgyud //
translated: Just as a person sets in motion

original: rdog thabs gcig gis bskyod pa na //
analyzed: rdog thabs gcig gis bskyod pa na //
translated: a waterwheel with a single foot-step,

original: thams @159b cad cig car 'gul ba ltar //
analyzed: thams @159b cad cig car 'gul ba ltar //
translated: and all [the buckets] move simultaneously,

original: skad cig gcig shes de bzhin no //
analyzed: skad cig gcig shes de bzhin no //

analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni de'i dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is by the momentum of a previous impulse.

original: rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid gnas skabs kyi zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig gis mngon bar rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid gnas skabs kyi zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig gis mngon bar rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The reality of karmic maturation is all uncontaminated phenomena of the occasion, which are fully and perfectly enlightened in a single instant.🔽With regard to that, it is taught:

original: gang tshe chos dkar thams cad kyi //
analyzed: gang tshe chos dkar thams cad kyi //
translated: When the nature of all virtuous phenomena

original: rang bzhin shes rab pha rol phyin //
analyzed: rang bzhin shes rab pha rol phyin //
translated: is the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam smin chos nyid gnas skabs skyes //
analyzed: rnam smin chos nyid gnas skabs skyes //
translated: the reality of karmic maturation arises on the occasion of

original: de tshe skad cig gcig ye shes //🔽zhes bstan pa ni gang rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe yang dag pa'am /
analyzed: de tshe skad cig gcig ye shes // zhes bstan pa ni gang rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe yang dag pa'am /
translated: the single instant of wisdom.🔽With regard to that, Subhūti, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not see any phenomenon that is real or

original: yongs su grub pa'i chos gang yang dag par rjes su mthong ba med de zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i chos gang yang dag par rjes su mthong ba med de zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: completely established.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung pa'i phyogs thams cad chos nyid kyi gnas skabs su mtshan ma med pa'i sbyor bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung pa'i phyogs thams cad chos nyid kyi gnas skabs su mtshan ma med pa'i sbyor bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: In the state of reality, all aspects of the maturation process are understood through the practice of signlessness, and the perfection of wisdom is perfected.

original: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa nyid kyis na /
translated: Because of the single instant of clear realization,
