analyzed: rnam par smin pa dus gcig tu skyes pa dang mi 'gal bar shes par byed pa'i phyir zhes rgya cher gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it should be understood that it is not contradictory for the maturation process to be produced in a single instant.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the single instant of clear realization of all signless phenomena,🔽the sūtra says:

original: sbyin la sogs pa'i spyod pa yis //
analyzed: sbyin la sogs pa'i spyod pa yis //
translated: Through the practice of generosity and so on,

original: chos kun rmi lam 'drar gnas nas //
analyzed: chos kun rmi lam 'drar gnas nas //
translated: while abiding in the dreamlike nature of all phenomena,

original: chos rnams mtshan nyid med pa nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams mtshan nyid med pa nyid //
translated: the characteristic of phenomena is understood

original: skad cig ma ni gcig gis rtogs //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni gcig gis rtogs //
translated: in a single instant.

original: zhes bstan pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid chos gcig gi khongs su 'dus pa mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid chos gcig gi khongs su 'dus pa mi 'thad pas /
translated: This is taught because it is untenable that the characteristics of phenomena that are mutually distinct, as they have been explained, are included within a single phenomenon.

original: skad cig ma gcig mngon par rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig mngon par rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, it follows that there is no realization in a single moment.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing /🔽sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing / sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: abiding in the five appropriated aggregates that are like a dream,🔽give gifts.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher gsungs pas /🔽chos thams cad mtshan ma @160a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher gsungs pas / chos thams cad mtshan ma @160a * //
translated: Beginning from here, it is extensively taught up to “they know all phenomena to be without characteristics.”🔽Therefore, because all phenomena are realized in a single moment to be without characteristics,

original: med par skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: without signs,🔽without conceptualization,🔽and without appearance,

original: rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: “like a dream” means the nature of a dream.

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: The term “without characteristics” means “nonexistent.”

original: 'di ltar chos mthun pa'i dpe don yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos mthun pa'i dpe don yin no //
translated: Thus, the example is similar to the meaning.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa de'i dus su bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par stong pa nyid yid la byed pas kun tu spyod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa de'i dus su bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par stong pa nyid yid la byed pas kun tu spyod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one practices generosity and so on at that time with the mind of emptiness, which is accompanied by obstacles and without obstacles.

original: chos bsags pa yang dgos par shes par bsam pa dang bcas pa dang / rtogs pa'i gnas skabs su ni chos rnams ro gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bsags pa yang dgos par shes par bsam pa dang bcas pa dang / rtogs pa'i gnas skabs su ni chos rnams ro gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The accumulation of the Dharma is also the cause of understanding the meaning of the Dharma, which is to be realized, because the dharmas are of one taste.

original: dbye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ngo bo nyid kyi don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ngo bo nyid kyi don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One realizes the meaning of the essence because there is no differentiation.

original: de phung po rnams ni shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de phung po rnams ni shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The aggregates are utterly nirvāṇa.

original: byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu yin pas /
analyzed: byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu yin pas /
translated: Awakening is also like a dream, utterly nirvāṇa.

original: phung po rnams dang byang chub ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang byang chub ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the aggregates and awakening are nondual and indivisible.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpes tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lnga po mdo ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpes tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lnga po mdo ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the five perfections beginning with morality should be explained according to the sutra, using the examples of dreams, etc.🔽With reference to the nondual realization of all dharmas in a single moment,

original: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig la mngon bar rtogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig la mngon bar rtogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: it is said:

original: rmi lam dang ni de mthong nyid //
analyzed: rmi lam dang ni de mthong nyid //
translated: Just as a dream and the one who sees it

original: gnyis kyi tshul du mi mthong ltar //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul du mi mthong ltar //
translated: are not seen in a dualistic way,

original: chos rnams gnyis su med pa yi //
analyzed: chos rnams gnyis su med pa yi //
translated: so the nonduality of all dharmas

original: de nyid skad cig gcig gis mthong //
analyzed: de nyid skad cig gcig gis mthong //
translated: is seen in a single moment.

original: zhes bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽rmi lam mi mthong /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / rmi lam mi mthong /
translated: Subhuti, here a bodhisattva mahasattva, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,🔽does not see a dream,

original: rmi lam mthong ba mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rmi lam mthong ba mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: does not see the one who sees a dream, and so on.

original: de ni chos de dag dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ni chos de dag dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: That is the non-duality of those phenomena and this perfection of wisdom, which cannot be made into two.

original: chos thams cad gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rtogs pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dbyer med mi dge ba'i chos bstan ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / de brjod pa de 'jug pa'i rgyu btsal ba'i don dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rtogs pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dbyer med mi dge ba'i chos bstan ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / de brjod pa de 'jug pa'i rgyu btsal ba'i don dang /
translated: Starting from here, it explains the single instant of clear realization of all phenomena by the characteristic of non-duality, the consequence of the non-existence of non-virtuous phenomena without distinction, and the purpose of seeking the cause of engaging in that expression.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid brjod du med @160b pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid brjod du med @160b pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because the reality of phenomena is inexpressible.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la mkhas pa ni chos kyi skur brtags pa 'byor pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la mkhas pa ni chos kyi skur brtags pa 'byor pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it teaches that being skilled in the nature of all phenomena is the mastery of the imputed Dharma body.

original: de ltar byas na skad cig ma //
analyzed: de ltar byas na skad cig ma //
translated: If it is done in that way,🔽in a single instant,

original: gcig gis mngon rdzogs byang chub pa //🔽mtshan nyid kyis ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: gcig gis mngon rdzogs byang chub pa // mtshan nyid kyis ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: there is complete enlightenment.

original: zhes bstan pa ;
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ;
translated: It is taught to have four characteristics.

original: de 'das pa'i 'brel pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de 'das pa'i 'brel pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That should be regarded as the relationship of past and future.🔽The meaning of realization in one moment is contradicted by the sutra that states:

original: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa'i don ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyi sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du yid la byed pa dang / kun 'byung la kun 'byung zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa'i don ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyi sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du yid la byed pa dang / kun 'byung la kun 'byung zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The noble disciples who possess uncontaminated attention attend to suffering as suffering, they attend to origin as origin, and so on up to

original: lam la lam du yid la byed pa'i bar du zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa dang / yang dag par ldan pa'i chos rnams la rnam par dpyad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i mdo dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: lam la lam du yid la byed pa'i bar du zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa dang / yang dag par ldan pa'i chos rnams la rnam par dpyad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i mdo dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: they attend to the path as the path and they investigate phenomena and so on.

original: de ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyi yin par shes pas kho bo cag dang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa nyan thos kyi yin par shes pas kho bo cag dang 'gal ba med de /
translated: We do not contradict that sutra because it refers to the realization of noble disciples,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mngon bar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mngon bar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: but this is the realization of bodhisattvas.

original: 'dir mkhas pa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba mang du yod mod kyi skad cig ma gcig la mngon bar byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid bdag gis nye bar sbyar ba'i rjes su 'brangs te /
analyzed: 'dir mkhas pa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba mang du yod mod kyi skad cig ma gcig la mngon bar byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid bdag gis nye bar sbyar ba'i rjes su 'brangs te /
translated: Although there is much to be said here by the learned, following the definition of the moment of enlightenment,

original: de lta bu 'khor ba thog ba med pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud par goms pas rab tu zhen ci bsngags pa'i nye bar dmigs pa la mngon bar zhen pa'i dug gis zin pa las bzlog pa la 'bad par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bu 'khor ba thog ba med pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud par goms pas rab tu zhen ci bsngags pa'i nye bar dmigs pa la mngon bar zhen pa'i dug gis zin pa las bzlog pa la 'bad par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: it is proper to strive to turn away from the poison of attachment to the object of praise, which is the result of the habit of samsara, which has no beginning and passes from one life to another.

original: mngon bar rtogs pa'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon bar rtogs pa'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of abhisamaya?

original: mngon bar rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: mngon bar rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon du 'phags pa'o //
translated: Abhisamaya is the manifestation of the noble.

original: sam gyi sgra ni nges par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sam gyi sgra ni nges par brjod pa'o //
translated: The word sam means to express.

original: aa'i sgra ni 'gro ba'i don no //
analyzed: aa'i sgra ni 'gro ba'i don no //
translated: The word abhi means to go.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: mngon du phyogs pas yang dag pa ji lta bar nges par 'gro ba'i ye shes rtogs pa ni mngon bar rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pas yang dag pa ji lta bar nges par 'gro ba'i ye shes rtogs pa ni mngon bar rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The realization of the wisdom that goes to the truth of reality by means of manifestation is called abhisamaya.

original: mngon bar rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las /
analyzed: mngon bar rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las /
translated: The Ornament of Clear Realization is a treatise on the perfection of wisdom that is an instruction on🔽the clear realizations.

original: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon bar rtogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon bar rtogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: It is a commentary on the clear realizations in a single verse.

original: // / da ni chos ku sku brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni chos ku sku brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the dharmakāya will be discussed.

original: de yang sku gsum du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang sku gsum du shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as having three bodies:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: the svābhāvikakāya, the sāmbhogikakāya, and the nairmāṇikakāya.

original: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Because the svābhāvikakāya is the basis of the other two bodies,

original: thub pa'i @161a * //
analyzed: thub pa'i @161a * //
translated: the Tathāgata’s

original: ngo bo nyid sku ni //🔽zag pa med chos rnam kun du //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid sku ni // zag pa med chos rnam kun du //
translated: svābhāvikakāya🔽is the purity of all aspects

original: rnam par dag 'gyur gang dag yin //
analyzed: rnam par dag 'gyur gang dag yin //
translated: of all uncontaminated qualities.

original: de dag de yi rang bzhin can //
analyzed: de dag de yi rang bzhin can //
translated: It is the nature of those qualities.

original: zhes bstan pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i chos dbyings yang dag pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i chos dbyings yang dag pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: This is taught by the verse. The nature of the svābhāvikakāya is the dharmadhātu, which is the purity of all aspects of all uncontaminated qualities.

original: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa 'di ni bcos ma ma yin pa'i don gyis na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa 'di ni bcos ma ma yin pa'i don gyis na /
translated: This nature is not fabricated.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the Bhagavat’s essential body is the Dharma Body.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin par 'jig rten la grags so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin par 'jig rten la grags so //
translated: The word “essential” means “unfabricated,” as is well known in the world.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ni de thob par byed pa po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ni de thob par byed pa po ni ma yin no //
translated: The supramundane path is not the agent that obtains it.🔽It is the reality that is the object of the supramundane path, and it is the essential body because it is the basis of the Master’s powers, etc.🔽What is the essential body?

original: gang yang rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The essential body is the Dharma Body, which is the pure reality of all dharmas.

original: chos kyi sku zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi sku zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the dharmas without outflows?🔽The factors of enlightenment, the immeasurables,

original: byang chub phyogs mthun tshad med dang // rnam par thar dang mthar gyis ni //
analyzed: byang chub phyogs mthun tshad med dang // rnam par thar dang mthar gyis ni //
translated: the liberations, the totalities,🔽the masteries, the spheres of mastery,

original: snyoms 'jug dgu yi bdag nyid dang // zad par bcu yi bdag nyid dang // zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni //
analyzed: snyoms 'jug dgu yi bdag nyid dang // zad par bcu yi bdag nyid dang // zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni //
translated: the spheres of totality, the spheres of totality, the spheres of emptiness,🔽the spheres of limitlessness, and the spheres of nothingness.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam brgyad dang // nyon mongs med dang smon med dang // mngon mkhyen so so yang dag rig / rnam pa thams cad dag bzhi dang // dbang bcu dang ni stobs bcu dang // mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi dag dang ; / bsrung ba med pa gsum dag dang //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam brgyad dang // nyon mongs med dang smon med dang // mngon mkhyen so so yang dag rig / rnam pa thams cad dag bzhi dang // dbang bcu dang ni stobs bcu dang // mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi dag dang ; / bsrung ba med pa gsum dag dang //
translated: the four fearlessnesses,🔽the three closely placed recollections,🔽the three foundations of mindfulness,🔽the nature of nonforgetfulness,🔽the complete destruction of the latencies,

original: dran pa nyer gzhag rnam gsum dang // bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid dang // bag chags yang dag bcom pa dang // skye la thugs rje chen po dang // thub pa kho na'i ma 'dres chos //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag rnam gsum dang // bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid dang // bag chags yang dag bcom pa dang // skye la thugs rje chen po dang // thub pa kho na'i ma 'dres chos //
translated: great compassion for beings,🔽and the eighteen distinctive qualities🔽of the Muni alone.🔽These are said to be the qualities

original: bco brgyad bshad pa gang yin dang // rnam pa pa thams cad mkhyen nyid dang // chos kyi sku zhes brjod pa yin //🔽zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: bco brgyad bshad pa gang yin dang // rnam pa pa thams cad mkhyen nyid dang // chos kyi sku zhes brjod pa yin // zhes bstan pa la /
translated: of the Dharma body,🔽the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and the Dharma body.

original: bdag nyid phyis pas chos kyi sku la chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid phyis pas chos kyi sku la chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma body is so called because it is the support of the qualities.

original: gzhan du na chos kyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o zhes byas pa na ngo bo nyid bkag par gyur pa dang / sku'i don bsags pa la yang 'gro bas 'dus byas su 'gyur ba'i nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: gzhan du na chos kyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o zhes byas pa na ngo bo nyid bkag par gyur pa dang / sku'i don bsags pa la yang 'gro bas 'dus byas su 'gyur ba'i nyes pa yod do //
translated: Otherwise, if the Dharma Body were called the Dharma Body, then its essence would be negated, and the meaning of Body would be reduced to an accumulation, so that the fault would be incurred that it would be a compounded entity.

original: de bas na sku zhes brjod pa de la sngon gyi gnas skabs kyi rjes su 'brangs pa'i nye bar gdags pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sku zhes brjod pa de la sngon gyi gnas skabs kyi rjes su 'brangs pa'i nye bar gdags pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the designation of Body is based on the prior state.

original: de la byang chub kyi phyogs dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ni bshad pa dang bcas pa'i skabs @161b rgyas par lam gyi tshogs las /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi phyogs dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ni bshad pa dang bcas pa'i skabs @161b rgyas par lam gyi tshogs las /
translated: The factors of enlightenment, beginning with the applications of mindfulness, have been explained in the chapter on the path of preparation.

original: ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as they are explained there.

original: tshad med pa ni byams pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa ni byams pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The immeasurables are loving-kindness and so on,

original: tshad med pa la 'jug pa las ji skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa la 'jug pa las ji skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: as they are explained in the Stages of Yogic Practice.🔽The eight liberations are:

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni gzugs can gzugs la blta ba 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni gzugs can gzugs la blta ba 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is the perception of form by one who is in a state of concentration.

original: nang du gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la blta ba 'di ni gnyis pa'o //🔽sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyi mngon sum du byas nas /
analyzed: nang du gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la blta ba 'di ni gnyis pa'o // sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyi mngon sum du byas nas /
translated: The second is to perceive internally a visible form and to see external visible forms.

original: rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is to actualize and perfect the liberation called “beautiful.”🔽The four liberations are called “infinite space,” “infinite consciousness,” “nothingness,” and “neither perception nor non-perception.”

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa dang // rnam shes mtha' yas pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba'i rnam par thar pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i zhes bya ba gcig te /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa dang // rnam shes mtha' yas pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba'i rnam par thar pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i zhes bya ba gcig te /
translated: The eighth is called “the cessation of perception and feeling.”

original: de ltar na brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are eight.

original: de la zad pa dang / yongs su chad pa dang / kun du bskor bas 'di'i mtha' yod pa ma yin pas /🔽nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la zad pa dang / yongs su chad pa dang / kun du bskor bas 'di'i mtha' yod pa ma yin pas / nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, since there is no end to the exhaustion, cessation, and turning away of the defilements,🔽space is infinite.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called “infinite space.”

original: 'di ni nam mkha' rgyur byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nam mkha' rgyur byas pa'o //
translated: This is the liberation that takes space as its object.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa de la bsam gtan brten pa'i don gyis ni skye mched de /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa de la bsam gtan brten pa'i don gyis ni skye mched de /
translated: The base of infinite space is so called because it is the basis of the meditative concentration that is supported on infinite space.

original: lha rnams kyi gnas dang 'dra bas na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched do //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi gnas dang 'dra bas na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched do //
translated: It is called the base of infinite space because it is like the abode of the gods.

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa nyid ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa nyid ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
translated: The base of infinite consciousness is the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de yongs su chad pa dang / kun du bskor bas 'di'i mtha' yas pa ma yin pas rnam shes mtha' yas so //🔽ming nas nam mkhar rnam par shes pa 'jug pas te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de yongs su chad pa dang / kun du bskor bas 'di'i mtha' yas pa ma yin pas rnam shes mtha' yas so // ming nas nam mkhar rnam par shes pa 'jug pas te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Since it is limited and circumscribed, it is not infinite.

original: 'di'i rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa yin pas na rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa yin pas na rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
translated: It is called the base of infinite consciousness because consciousness is infinite there, as before.

original: 'di la yan lag tsam yang lus pa med pas na ci yang med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag tsam yang lus pa med pas na ci yang med pa ste /
translated: The base of nothingness is so called because nothing but the mere parts of the body remain.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba la de skad ces ming btags pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba la de skad ces ming btags pa yin no //
translated: It is called the base of nothingness because it is free from the base of infinite consciousness.

original: bsam gtan 'di yang med pa la brten pas na /
analyzed: bsam gtan 'di yang med pa la brten pas na /
translated: This meditative concentration is called the base of neither-discrimination-nor-nondiscrimination because it is supported on the base of nothingness.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The sphere of nothingness, etc. are as above.

original: rgya che ba'i 'du shes ni med la phra mo ni yod pas na /
analyzed: rgya che ba'i 'du shes ni med la phra mo ni yod pas na /
translated: The ideation of immensity is absent, but the ideation of subtlety is present.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min te /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min te /
translated: Therefore, it is called the sphere of neither ideation nor non-ideation.

original: de dang yang dag par ldan pa'i @162a * //
analyzed: de dang yang dag par ldan pa'i @162a * //
translated: The fourth meditation is associated with this ideation.

original: bsam gtan ni 'du shes med 'du shas med min no //🔽'du shes med 'du shes med min yang yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni 'du shes med 'du shas med min no // 'du shes med 'du shes med min yang yin la /
translated: It is called the sphere of neither ideation nor non-ideation.

original: de ni chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa nyid kyi skye mched kyang yin pas na 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa nyid kyi skye mched kyang yin pas na 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: It is also called the sphere of neither ideation nor non-ideation because it is associated with this ideation and because it is included in the sphere of the factors.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyang dmigs pa las yang dag par 'da' ba nyid kyis 'thob kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang dmigs pa las yang dag par 'da' ba nyid kyis 'thob kyi /
translated: All of these are obtained by transcending the object,

original: yan lag las 'das pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag las 'das pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by transcending the members.

original: dper na bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa dang / zad par sa la sogs pa dmigs pa gcig la dmigs pa ma spangs par rtogs pa la sogs pa'i yan lag las yang dag par 'das par gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: dper na bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa dang / zad par sa la sogs pa dmigs pa gcig la dmigs pa ma spangs par rtogs pa la sogs pa'i yan lag las yang dag par 'das par gyur pa yin na /
translated: For example, the first concentration, etc., and the totalities of earth, etc., are attained only by transcending the object, not by transcending the factors such as investigation, etc.

original: 'di rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But these are not like that.

original: gang gzugs kyi mtshan ma las 'das pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi mtshan ma las 'das pa dang po'o //
translated: The first is the transcending of the signs of form.

original: nam mkha' las 'das pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' las 'das pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the transcending of space.

original: nam mkhar zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'das pa ni gsum pa'o ;
analyzed: nam mkhar zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'das pa ni gsum pa'o ;
translated: The third is the transcending of consciousness entering space.

original: / nam mkhar zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa las 'das pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: / nam mkhar zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa las 'das pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the transcending of the non-existence of consciousness entering space.

original: de ltar na 'di dag thams cad dmigs pa 'di las 'das pa nyid las thob kyi yan lag las 'das pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag thams cad dmigs pa 'di las 'das pa nyid las thob kyi yan lag las 'das pas ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, all of these are attained only by transcending the object, not by transcending the factors.

original: de dag thams cad kyang btang snyoms dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid la rag las pa yin pas de dag gi yan lag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang btang snyoms dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid la rag las pa yin pas de dag gi yan lag gnyis pa'o //
translated: Because all of them depend on equanimity and one-pointedness of mind, they have two factors.

original: ji ltar spom pa dang / phra ba dang / rab tu phra ba dang / shin tu phra ba'i dog pa las chu dang / zheng mnyam pa'i ras gos bzhi po la tshad kyi khyad par med du zin kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar spom pa dang / phra ba dang / rab tu phra ba dang / shin tu phra ba'i dog pa las chu dang / zheng mnyam pa'i ras gos bzhi po la tshad kyi khyad par med du zin kyang /
translated: Just as, in the case of a cloth of the same length and breadth as a square cubit, there is no difference in size between the four pieces of cloth,

original: bde ba'i reg pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo dang / che ba nyid kyis snga ma las cig shos dang / phyi ma las phyi ma phul du byung bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i reg pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo dang / che ba nyid kyis snga ma las cig shos dang / phyi ma las phyi ma phul du byung bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: but there is a difference in the quality of the pleasure of touch, the second is better than the first, and the fourth is better than the third.

original: de bzhin du 'di dag gi khyad par med du zin kyang bsgom pa'i khyad par gyis phra ba dang / zhi ba'i ngo bo nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir snga ma las phyi ma cig shos dag tu phul du byung ba dang / mchog tu phul du byung ba nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di dag gi khyad par med du zin kyang bsgom pa'i khyad par gyis phra ba dang / zhi ba'i ngo bo nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir snga ma las phyi ma cig shos dag tu phul du byung ba dang / mchog tu phul du byung ba nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, although there is no difference in their object, the later liberations are better and best because they are respectively characterized by subtlety and peacefulness, due to the difference in the cultivation of the liberations.

original: rnam par thar pa'i lhag ma bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i lhag ma bshad pa ni /
translated: The remaining liberations are explained.

original: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: They are just as they are described in the explanation of the complete and perfect realization of all aspects.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni bsam gtan @162b bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni bsam gtan @162b bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nine serial absorptions are called the four meditative concentrations, the four formless absorptions, and the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: zad par gyi skye mched bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten universal bases are as follows:

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po ste zad par brgyad dang / zad par rnam par shes pa dang / zad par nam mkha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po ste zad par brgyad dang / zad par rnam par shes pa dang / zad par nam mkha' zhes bya'o //
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, blue, yellow, red, white, the universal base of contact, and the universal base of factors.

original: de la zad par sa ni rnal 'byor goms pa gang zhig dbang du gyur pas bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin las 'das nas sgrib pa cung zad lus pas snyoms par 'jug pas na rnam par rtog pa rags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la zad par sa ni rnal 'byor goms pa gang zhig dbang du gyur pas bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin las 'das nas sgrib pa cung zad lus pas snyoms par 'jug pas na rnam par rtog pa rags pa'i phyir /
translated: The universal base of earth is the meditative absorption of a yogi who, having transcended the meditative concentrations and meditative attainments, enters meditative absorption due to the power of his familiarity with the practice.

original: yan lag nyam chung ba zhes bya ba'i nyes pa de mthong nas /
analyzed: yan lag nyam chung ba zhes bya ba'i nyes pa de mthong nas /
translated: He sees the fault of the weakness of the branches, which is due to the coarseness of discursive thought because he still has some obscurations.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa zhi ba nyid du yid la byed pas de gnyis pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /🔽dang po la 'dod pa med pa yongs su bzung nas bsam gtan gyi yan lag la so sor rnam par rtog pa na rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi rags pa lam spyod pa la sogs pa zhi ba nyid du nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa zhi ba nyid du yid la byed pas de gnyis pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir / dang po la 'dod pa med pa yongs su bzung nas bsam gtan gyi yan lag la so sor rnam par rtog pa na rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi rags pa lam spyod pa la sogs pa zhi ba nyid du nye bar gnas so //
translated: Since one attends to the second meditative concentration as peace, one takes up the second meditative concentration.🔽When one takes up the second meditative concentration, one does not desire the first meditative concentration. When one discriminates the factors of the second meditative concentration, the coarseness of mere conceptualization is pacified.

original: de'i tshe rags pa'i yan lag spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mtshan ma de nyid sa yin no zhes yang dang yang du yid la byed pas zad par sa la rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de'i tshe rags pa'i yan lag spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mtshan ma de nyid sa yin no zhes yang dang yang du yid la byed pas zad par sa la rnam par 'jog go //
translated: At that time, in order to abandon the coarse factors, one repeatedly attends to the sign of the second meditative concentration, thinking, “This is the second meditative concentration.” Thus, one is established in the second meditative concentration.

original: de bzhin du zad par chu la sogs pa dgu po la yang tshul de nyid ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zad par chu la sogs pa dgu po la yang tshul de nyid ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the nine, such as the sphere of infinite space, in accordance with this method.

original: sngar bsgoms pa goms pa dang / chu bo dang / rdzing bu dang / mtsho la sogs pa las ni ma byas pa nyid du zad par chu 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du nags kyi me 'bar ba'i du ba'i rtse mo la sogs pa las ni zad par me 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sngar bsgoms pa goms pa dang / chu bo dang / rdzing bu dang / mtsho la sogs pa las ni ma byas pa nyid du zad par chu 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du nags kyi me 'bar ba'i du ba'i rtse mo la sogs pa las ni zad par me 'byung ngo //
translated: The all-encompassing element of fire arises from the smoke, etc. of a forest fire.

original: rlung gis phyogs pa'i 'od ma dang / ljon shing gi lo ma la sogs pa la rlung 'di gnas te /🔽'di rab tu 'jig par byed do zhes pa las ni zad par rlung 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rlung gis phyogs pa'i 'od ma dang / ljon shing gi lo ma la sogs pa la rlung 'di gnas te / 'di rab tu 'jig par byed do zhes pa las ni zad par rlung 'byung ngo //
translated: The all-encompassing element of wind arises from the bamboo, trees, leaves, etc. that are blown by the wind.

original: me tog dang / nor bu dang / gos la sogs pa sngon po bting ba las ni zad par sngon po'o //
analyzed: me tog dang / nor bu dang / gos la sogs pa sngon po bting ba las ni zad par sngon po'o //
translated: The all-encompassing element of blue arises from the blue flowers, jewels, clothes, etc.🔽The all-encompassing element of yellow arises from the yellow flowers, jewels, clothes, etc.🔽The all-encompassing element of red arises from the red flowers, jewels, clothes, etc.

original: de ltar ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po las ni zang par ser po la sogs pa dang / tshon steng dang / dngul dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa las ni zad par dkar po'o //
analyzed: de ltar ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po las ni zang par ser po la sogs pa dang / tshon steng dang / dngul dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa las ni zad par dkar po'o //
translated: The all-encompassing element of white arises from the white flowers, jewels, clothes, etc., and from the sun, moon, and silver.

original: skar khung gi nang du zhugs pa'i zla zer dang / nyi ma'i 'od kyi sa dang / rtsig pa'i phyogs kyi snang ba'i tshogs byung ba dang / shing ge @163a * //🔽lo ma'i tshogs kyi gseb nas byung ba'i snang ba dang / rlung gis bskyod pa'i zla ba'i 'od zer lta ba las ni zad par rnam par shes pa'o //🔽skar khung gi nang gi bu ga dang / rtsig khung dang / khung bu la sogs pa las ni zad par nam mkha' skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽gang yang bsgom pa ma byas pa'i las dang po pa la ni rnal 'byor 'di lta bu skye bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: skar khung gi nang du zhugs pa'i zla zer dang / nyi ma'i 'od kyi sa dang / rtsig pa'i phyogs kyi snang ba'i tshogs byung ba dang / shing ge @163a * // lo ma'i tshogs kyi gseb nas byung ba'i snang ba dang / rlung gis bskyod pa'i zla ba'i 'od zer lta ba las ni zad par rnam par shes pa'o // skar khung gi nang gi bu ga dang / rtsig khung dang / khung bu la sogs pa las ni zad par nam mkha' skye bar 'gyur ro // gang yang bsgom pa ma byas pa'i las dang po pa la ni rnal 'byor 'di lta bu skye bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: The light of the moon and sun entering through the window, the collection of lights on the side of the wall, the light arising from the collection of leaves of the tree, and the light of the moon stirred by the wind.🔽From looking at the light, the consciousness of the totality of light arises.🔽From the holes in the window, the holes in the wall, the holes in the ground, and so on, the consciousness of the totality of space arises.🔽🔽For beginners who have not yet cultivated this, this kind of yoga will not arise.🔽

original: gos gtsang ma las 'dzag pa'i gzhong pa la sogs pa'i snod gang yang rung ba chus bkang ba gnas shin tu bzang por bzhag la bde bar 'dug nas yid la byed pa brtsams par bya ste /
analyzed: gos gtsang ma las 'dzag pa'i gzhong pa la sogs pa'i snod gang yang rung ba chus bkang ba gnas shin tu bzang por bzhag la bde bar 'dug nas yid la byed pa brtsams par bya ste /
translated: He should place a vessel filled with water, such as a basin, on a good place, and sit down comfortably.

original: de ni zad par chu la yongs su sbyang ba'o //🔽yang snying po dang ldan pa dum bur gtubs la shing drung ngam /
analyzed: de ni zad par chu la yongs su sbyang ba'o // yang snying po dang ldan pa dum bur gtubs la shing drung ngam /
translated: This is the thorough clearing of the totality of water.

original: stegs bu zla med pa la lhung bzed rtsi btang ba'i tshul gyis 'bar bar byas la bug pa mtho gang ba'am /🔽sor bzhi pa zhig btod de /
analyzed: stegs bu zla med pa la lhung bzed rtsi btang ba'i tshul gyis 'bar bar byas la bug pa mtho gang ba'am / sor bzhi pa zhig btod de /
translated: Again, he should cut the essence-bearing wood into pieces and place the pieces in a bowl that has been treated with oil, either at the foot of a tree or on a platform.🔽He should make a hole in the bowl, either one hand-span or four finger-breadths high.

original: pags pa'am / re lde gang yang rung ba'i stan mdun du bzhag pa la bde bar 'dug nas 'og rdza dang / shing rnams la steng na du ba'i rtse mo yod pa yid la byas la /
analyzed: pags pa'am / re lde gang yang rung ba'i stan mdun du bzhag pa la bde bar 'dug nas 'og rdza dang / shing rnams la steng na du ba'i rtse mo yod pa yid la byas la /
translated: He should place in front of him a seat made of either hide or cane, and sit down comfortably.🔽He should visualize the smoke rising above the wood and charcoal below, and the flame in the middle.

original: dbus su me 'bar ba'i phung po stug po'i mtshan ma gzung bar bya ba ni zad par me'i yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: dbus su me 'bar ba'i phung po stug po'i mtshan ma gzung bar bya ba ni zad par me'i yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the thorough clearing of the totality of fire.

original: rtsig pa'i bu ga phug pa'am /
analyzed: rtsig pa'i bu ga phug pa'am /
translated: Or, if there is no opening, he should visualize the space inside a window opening.

original: med na yang bug pa'i skar khung gi nang khong seng byas pa dang / nye bar 'dug pa la yan lag gi phyogs gang du rlung gis reg pa der dran pa gtad par bya ste /
analyzed: med na yang bug pa'i skar khung gi nang khong seng byas pa dang / nye bar 'dug pa la yan lag gi phyogs gang du rlung gis reg pa der dran pa gtad par bya ste /
translated: He should direct his mindfulness to the place where the wind touches his body.

original: de ni zad par rlung gi yongs su sbyang ba'o //🔽autpala sngon po'am /🔽gi ni ga na ri ka la sogs pa'i sdong bu la sogs pa dang / ge sar bsal la ras sngon po'am /
analyzed: de ni zad par rlung gi yongs su sbyang ba'o // autpala sngon po'am / gi ni ga na ri ka la sogs pa'i sdong bu la sogs pa dang / ge sar bsal la ras sngon po'am /
translated: This is the complete training in the wind.🔽He should prepare a blue lotus,🔽or a stalk of blue lotus, or a blue flower, or a blue gem, or a blue cloth, or a blue bowl, or any other blue object.

original: zam tog kha sbyar la sogs pa snod gang yang rung ba bting zhing khengs par byas la /
analyzed: zam tog kha sbyar la sogs pa snod gang yang rung ba bting zhing khengs par byas la /
translated: He should place it on a blue cloth, or in a blue box, or in any other blue container.

original: ras sngon po de rnga bo che'i kha ltar g-yogs pa'am /
analyzed: ras sngon po de rnga bo che'i kha ltar g-yogs pa'am /
translated: He should cover the blue cloth like the mouth of a drum.

original: gzhan kha dog 'bar ba'i g-ya'am /🔽pa sha la sngon po'am /
analyzed: gzhan kha dog 'bar ba'i g-ya'am / pa sha la sngon po'am /
translated: Or he should cover it with a blue cloth,🔽or with a blue blanket,🔽or with a blue piece of cloth,🔽or with blue ointment,

original: mig sman sngon po la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: mig sman sngon po la sogs pa'am /
translated: or with any other blue substance.

original: tshon gyi rigs gang yang rung ba bsku zhing rtsig ngos la dkyil 'khor byas shing /
analyzed: tshon gyi rigs gang yang rung ba bsku zhing rtsig ngos la dkyil 'khor byas shing /
translated: He should make a mandala on the wall,

original: bsku bzlum po byas shing kha dog mi mthun pa gang yang rung bas yongs @163b su chod par byas la /
analyzed: bsku bzlum po byas shing kha dog mi mthun pa gang yang rung bas yongs @163b su chod par byas la /
translated: It should be completely covered with a dome-shaped lid of any color other than the color of the cloth.

original: de dang nye bar stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
analyzed: de dang nye bar stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
translated: Sitting on a comfortable seat nearby,

original: yid la byed pa la 'jug par byed pa 'di ni zad par sngon po las su rung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa la 'jug par byed pa 'di ni zad par sngon po las su rung bar bya'o //
translated: one should engage in mental attention, making oneself fit for the totality of blue.

original: zad par ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po yang tshul de nyid de khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zad par ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po yang tshul de nyid de khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The same method applies to the totality of yellow, red, and white. The difference is this:

original: gang dang gang du sngon po yin pa de dang der ser po la sogs pa'i kha dog tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang du sngon po yin pa de dang der ser po la sogs pa'i kha dog tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: wherever there is blue, one should apply the color yellow, etc.

original: yang bum pa'i nang du mar me btang la de'i kha bkab ste /
analyzed: yang bum pa'i nang du mar me btang la de'i kha bkab ste /
translated: Again, a lamp should be lit inside a pot, and its opening should be covered.

original: bu ga ha cang mi che ba zhig byas la /
analyzed: bu ga ha cang mi che ba zhig byas la /
translated: A hole should be made in it that is not too big.

original: rtsig pa la mngon du phyogs par bzhag nas mar me de las byung pa'i snang bas rtsig ngos la phog pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor yun ring du gnas par gyur pa la /
analyzed: rtsig pa la mngon du phyogs par bzhag nas mar me de las byung pa'i snang bas rtsig ngos la phog pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor yun ring du gnas par gyur pa la /
translated: Placing it facing a wall, one should rest for a long time in the maṇḍala of light that strikes the surface of the wall from that lamp.

original: de la yid gtod par byed pa de ni zad par rnam par shes pa las su rung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la yid gtod par byed pa de ni zad par rnam par shes pa las su rung bar bya ba'o //
translated: The attention to that is the serviceability of the totality of consciousness.

original: yang stegs bu dang / rtsig pa dang / rtsva stan dang / gos la sogs pas ma bkab pa'am /
analyzed: yang stegs bu dang / rtsig pa dang / rtsva stan dang / gos la sogs pas ma bkab pa'am /
translated: Moreover, one should not cover the space with a platform, wall, grass mat, cloth, etc.

original: kun nas ma bkab pa'am /🔽kun nas bkab pa der bu ga mtho gang ba'am /
analyzed: kun nas ma bkab pa'am / kun nas bkab pa der bu ga mtho gang ba'am /
translated: One should not cover it completely.🔽One should make a hole in it one cubit or four fingerbreadths high.

original: sor bzhi pa byas pa de la yid gtad par bya ste /
analyzed: sor bzhi pa byas pa de la yid gtad par bya ste /
translated: One should direct one's attention to that.

original: yongs su bcad pa 'di ni zad par nam mkha' las su rung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bcad pa 'di ni zad par nam mkha' las su rung bar bya ba'o //
translated: This is the definition of the serviceability of the totality of space.

original: de ltar na re zhig de dag ni yongs su sbyang ba'i khyad par yin par shes par bya'o //🔽de yang rnam pa dgu char yang zad par byas pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig de dag ni yongs su sbyang ba'i khyad par yin par shes par bya'o // de yang rnam pa dgu char yang zad par byas pa'am /
translated: Thus, one should understand that these are the special purifications.

original: ma byas pa la 'dzin pa dang / so sor snang ba zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis su 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa la 'dzin pa dang / so sor snang ba zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis su 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, in the case of all nine, there is the arising of the two characteristics called the sign of apprehension and the sign of appearance.

original: zad par chu gang yin par 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma ni rab tu g-yo ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: zad par chu gang yin par 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma ni rab tu g-yo ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The sign of apprehension of the totality of water is the aspect of movement.

original: lbu ba dang / chu bur dang / 'dres pa'i char snang ba de lta bu kho nar gyur nas nye bar gnas pa ni zad par gyi nyes pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lbu ba dang / chu bur dang / 'dres pa'i char snang ba de lta bu kho nar gyur nas nye bar gnas pa ni zad par gyi nyes pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the fault of exhaustion is when it appears as if a bubble, a water bubble, or a mixed rain, and then disappears.

original: so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni nam mkha' la bkab pa'i g-yo 'gul med pa ni nor bu'i rlung g-yab 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni nam mkha' la bkab pa'i g-yo 'gul med pa ni nor bu'i rlung g-yab 'dra ba'am /
translated: The sign of individual appearance is like a jeweled fan, or like the surface of a mirror made of jewels, which is motionless when covered with space.

original: nor bu las byas pa'i me long gi dkyil 'khor lta bur gyur nas gnas so //
analyzed: nor bu las byas pa'i me long gi dkyil 'khor lta bur gyur nas gnas so //
translated: It becomes and abides.

original: zad par me'i 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma ni rtse mo'i cha g-yo ba'am /
analyzed: zad par me'i 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma ni rtse mo'i cha g-yo ba'am /
translated: The sign of the apprehension of the totality of fire is the moving or abiding of the tip part,

original: chad pa ltar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa ltar gnas pa'o //
translated: as if it were moving or shaking.

original: 'dir ma byas pa la zad par gyi nyes par shes par bya ba ni mgal me dang / me mdag gi dum bu dang / thal ba dang / du ba la cung zad gnas nas so //
analyzed: 'dir ma byas pa la zad par gyi nyes par shes par bya ba ni mgal me dang / me mdag gi dum bu dang / thal ba dang / du ba la cung zad gnas nas so //
translated: Here, the fault of exhaustion should be understood in the unaccomplished, which abides for a little while in a firebrand, a piece of burning coal, ashes, or smoke.

original: so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni nam mkha' ltar bzhag pa'i @164a * //🔽la ba dmar po lta bu'am /
analyzed: so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni nam mkha' ltar bzhag pa'i @164a * // la ba dmar po lta bu'am /
translated: The sign of individual appearance is like a red blanket,🔽like a golden fly-whisk,

original: gser gyi rnga yab lta bu'am /
analyzed: gser gyi rnga yab lta bu'am /
translated: or like a golden mirror.

original: gser gyi ka ba 'dra bar nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: gser gyi ka ba 'dra bar nye bar gnas so //
translated: It is like a golden pillar.

original: zad par rlung gi 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma ni 'o ma bskol ba phog ma thag pa'i rlangs pa'i rtse mo bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: zad par rlung gi 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma ni 'o ma bskol ba phog ma thag pa'i rlangs pa'i rtse mo bzhin du gnas so //
translated: The sign of the sphere of wind is like the top of boiling milk that has just been taken from the fire.

original: so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni legs par 'dug pa ltar mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni legs par 'dug pa ltar mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The sign of the sphere of discernment is like a well-formed [object] that does not move.

original: zad par sngon po ni me tog ge sar sdong bu med pa dang / ge sar sdong bu bcas pa dag cig shos 'dab ma phye ba lta bu de zad par gyi nyes par shes par bya'o //🔽so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni zad par dkyil 'khor gyen du 'phags te /
analyzed: zad par sngon po ni me tog ge sar sdong bu med pa dang / ge sar sdong bu bcas pa dag cig shos 'dab ma phye ba lta bu de zad par gyi nyes par shes par bya'o // so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni zad par dkyil 'khor gyen du 'phags te /
translated: The sphere of blue is like a flower with a stamen and without a stamen, and like a flower with a stamen and stamen, with petals that are half-opened. This should be known as the sphere of faults.

original: nam mkha' la nor bu'i rdul yab lta bur snang ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la nor bu'i rdul yab lta bur snang ba'o //
translated: The sign of the sphere of discernment is like a sphere that rises up and appears in the sky like a jeweled fan.

original: zad par ser po la sogs pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: zad par ser po la sogs pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The same method applies to the sphere of yellow and so on.

original: zad par rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni sa rtsig pa las gyen du 'phags te /🔽zlum po lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zad par rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni sa rtsig pa las gyen du 'phags te /🔽zlum po lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The sign of the sphere of consciousness is like a wall that rises up from the ground and becomes round.

original: so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni sdug cing dangs pa dang / snang ba'i tshogs lta bu'o //
analyzed: so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni sdug cing dangs pa dang / snang ba'i tshogs lta bu'o //
translated: The sign of the individual appearance is beautiful and clear, like a collection of lights.

original: zad par nam mkha'i 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma ni rtsig pa'i mtha'i bu ga dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: zad par nam mkha'i 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma ni rtsig pa'i mtha'i bu ga dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: The sign of the apprehension of the totality of space is like a hole in a wall.

original: bskyed na yang 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskyed na yang 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is extended, it does not increase.

original: so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni nam mkha'i dkyil nyid du gyur nas gnas la /
analyzed: so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma ni nam mkha'i dkyil nyid du gyur nas gnas la /
translated: The sign of the individual appearance is in the middle of space itself.

original: bskyed na yang 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskyed na yang 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is extended, it does not increase.

original: de ltar 'dir byang ba dang / ma byang ba'i zad par 'dzin pa dang / so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma dag gi khyad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir byang ba dang / ma byang ba'i zad par 'dzin pa dang / so sor snang ba'i mtshan ma dag gi khyad par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, here one should understand the difference between the signs of the apprehension of the totality and the individual appearance, which are respectively mastered and not mastered.

original: mtshan ma de dgu char la yang bde bar 'dug nas kha dog la brtag pa'i yid la byed pa spangs nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma de dgu char la yang bde bar 'dug nas kha dog la brtag pa'i yid la byed pa spangs nas /
translated: Having sat down comfortably in all nine signs, one should abandon the attention that examines the colors.

original: zad par sa zhes bya ba la mig gis ma bltas par brtags pa tsam la sems gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: zad par sa zhes bya ba la mig gis ma bltas par brtags pa tsam la sems gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Without looking with the eyes, one should place the mind in the mere investigation of the totality of earth.

original: chu chu me me zhes bya ba dang / de dang de'i ming gsal ba'i dbang nyid kyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: chu chu me me zhes bya ba dang / de dang de'i ming gsal ba'i dbang nyid kyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in the name of each element, such as water, water, fire, fire, and so on.

original: de ltar de rnams kyi de dang de la bslabs pa'i khyad par yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de rnams kyi de dang de la bslabs pa'i khyad par yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the difference is due to training in this and that.

original: de ltar bslabs pa na de rnams la snga ma ltar nye bar spyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin de rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bslabs pa na de rnams la snga ma ltar nye bar spyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin de rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one trains in this way, those concentrations with the former enjoyments will arise in those.

original: yang gang zad par sa zhes bya ba 'di la dbang thob pa ni mngon par shes pa thob pa yang gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / nam mkha'am /
analyzed: yang gang zad par sa zhes bya ba 'di la dbang thob pa ni mngon par shes pa thob pa yang gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / nam mkha'am /
translated: Again, one who has attained mastery over this called the totality of earth will become one who has attained supernormal knowledge, and will be able to transform many into one, and transform earth into water,

original: chu la sar sprul nas @164b rkang pa gnyis kyis 'gro ba la sogs pa dang / g-yo ba la sogs pa'i khyad par 'di 'byor par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu la sar sprul nas @164b rkang pa gnyis kyis 'gro ba la sogs pa dang / g-yo ba la sogs pa'i khyad par 'di 'byor par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be able to walk on water as if on earth, and so on, and will be able to transform earth into fire, and so on. This will be mastered.

original: yang zad par chu la dbang thob pas sa la byi zul byed pa dang / steng du 'byung ba dang / chu'i tshogs kyi char 'bebs pa dang / chu bo dang rgya mtsho la sogs par sprul pa dang / sa dang ri bo la sogs par ston par nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang zad par chu la dbang thob pas sa la byi zul byed pa dang / steng du 'byung ba dang / chu'i tshogs kyi char 'bebs pa dang / chu bo dang rgya mtsho la sogs par sprul pa dang / sa dang ri bo la sogs par ston par nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, by attaining mastery over water through the totalities, one can walk on the earth as if it were water, one can emerge from the earth, one can cause a rain of water to fall from the mass of water, one can emanate as water and oceans, and one can display as earth and mountains.

original: zad par me la dbang thob pa ni du ba 'thul ba dang / me rab tu 'bar zhing me mdag gi char rab tu 'bebs pa dang / me dang me rnams zil gyis gnon cing gang dang gang 'dod pa de dang de bsreg par nus pa nyid dang /
analyzed: zad par me la dbang thob pa ni du ba 'thul ba dang / me rab tu 'bar zhing me mdag gi char rab tu 'bebs pa dang / me dang me rnams zil gyis gnon cing gang dang gang 'dod pa de dang de bsreg par nus pa nyid dang /
translated: By attaining mastery over fire through the totalities, one can emit smoke and flames, one can cause a rain of embers to fall, one can overpower fire and flames, and one can burn whatever one wishes.

original: lha'i mig gi yul gyi snang ba bskyed par nus pa dang / snang bar byed pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: lha'i mig gi yul gyi snang ba bskyed par nus pa dang / snang bar byed pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
translated: One can generate the light of the domain of the divine eye, one can illuminate, and one can cremate the body at the time of parinirvāṇa.

original: dus su lus bsreg pa la sogs pa la 'byor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus su lus bsreg pa la sogs pa la 'byor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes powerful in burning the body and so on.

original: zad par rlung la dbang thob pa ni rlung gi 'gros ltar 'gro ba dang ; rlung gi tshogs bskyed par nus pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zad par rlung la dbang thob pa ni rlung gi 'gros ltar 'gro ba dang ; rlung gi tshogs bskyed par nus pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mastery of the wind of totalities is the ability to go as fast as the wind, to generate a wind assembly, and so on.

original: zad par sngon po la dbang thob pas ni gzugs sngon por sprul zhing mun par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zad par sngon po la dbang thob pas ni gzugs sngon por sprul zhing mun par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mastery of the blue of totalities is the ability to emanate forms as blue, to make darkness and so on.

original: zad par ser po la dbang thob pas ni gzugs ser por sprul pa dang / gser du bsgyur nus pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: zad par ser po la dbang thob pas ni gzugs ser por sprul pa dang / gser du bsgyur nus pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Mastery of the yellow of totalities is the ability to emanate forms as yellow, to transform into gold and so on.

original: / zad par dmar po la dbang thob pas ni gzugs dmar por sprul pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / zad par dmar po la dbang thob pas ni gzugs dmar por sprul pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mastery of the red of totalities is the ability to emanate forms as red and so on.

original: zad par dkar po la dbang thob pas ni gzugs dkar por sprul nus pa dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa thag ring du spong ba dang / mun par rnam par 'jig pa dang / lha'i mig gi yul snang bar byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zad par dkar po la dbang thob pas ni gzugs dkar por sprul nus pa dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa thag ring du spong ba dang / mun par rnam par 'jig pa dang / lha'i mig gi yul snang bar byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mastery of the white of totalities is the ability to emanate forms as white, to eliminate sleep and lethargy far away, to destroy darkness, to illuminate the domain of the divine eye and so on.

original: zad par rnam par shes pa la dbang thob pas ni gzugs 'od gsal bar sprul pa dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa rgyang ring du byed pa dang / mig gi yul gyi snang ba bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zad par rnam par shes pa la dbang thob pas ni gzugs 'od gsal bar sprul pa dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa rgyang ring du byed pa dang / mig gi yul gyi snang ba bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By obtaining mastery of the totality of consciousness, one manifests luminous form, one distances oneself from sleep and torpor, one produces the light of the visual object, etc.

original: zad par nam mkha' la dbang thob pas ni sgrib g-yogs rnams sgrib g-yogs med par byed pa dang / sa dang ri la sogs pa'i bar nam mkhar sprul nas /🔽spyod lam ston par byed pa dang / rtsig pa la sogs pa la thad kar thogs pa med par 'gro ba la sogs par 'byor bar 'gyur ro //

translated: By obtaining mastery of the totality of space, one makes the covered become uncovered; one manifests space in the earth, in mountains, etc.🔽and one shows the attitudes in it; one goes straight through walls, etc.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par zad par spros pa na zad par @165a * //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par zad par spros pa na zad par @165a * //

original: skye ma ched do //

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni brgyad do //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni brgyad do //

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes shing /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes shing /

analyzed: zhes bya ba me tog dang / gos dag kha dog sngo ba nyid du bstan pa'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: kha dog sngon po zhes bya ba ni me tog gi dbang du byas pa ste /

analyzed: de'i sngo ba ni lhan cig skyes pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Its blueness is natural, because it is innate.

analyzed: sngon por snang ba zhes bya ba ni gos kyi dbang du byas pa ste ;

analyzed: de'i sngon po ni sbyar ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mdog sngo bar mthong zhes bya ba ni me tog dang gos gnyi ga'i dbang du byas pa ste /

original: ao ma ka lta bu'i me tog phun sum @165b tshogs pa dang / yul b'a r'a na s'i'i gos ltar sngo ba /

analyzed: kha dog sngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa rigs pa yin no //
