translated: The blue one is like the color of the indranīla jewel, the yellow one is like the color of turmeric, the red one is like the color of the bandhujīvaka flower, the white one is like the color of the full autumn moon, and the variegated one is like the color of a variegated gem.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched do //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched do //
translated: The bases of mastery are so called because they are the bases for mastering the meditative development of the four investigations.🔽What is the base of totality?🔽The base of totality is so called because it is the base for the meditative development of the totality of the four investigations.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa gang zhe na /🔽bsam gtan la gnas nas pha rol po nyon mongs pa mi skye zhing rjes su bsrung bar gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa'i shes rab de dang yang dag par ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dgra mi bskyed pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa gang zhe na / bsam gtan la gnas nas pha rol po nyon mongs pa mi skye zhing rjes su bsrung bar gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa'i shes rab de dang yang dag par ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dgra mi bskyed pas /
translated: What is the absence of conflict?🔽The absence of conflict is the non-arising of conflict in others through one's meditative development of the concentrations.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of conflict because it is the absence of conflict in others through the meditative development of the concentrations.

original: de la nyan thos rnams las sangs rgyas kyi nyon mongs pa med pa'i khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la nyan thos rnams las sangs rgyas kyi nyon mongs pa med pa'i khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference between the absence of conflict of the Disciples and that of the Buddhas lies in the difference of their faculties and in the difference of their objects.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nyan thos nyon mongs med pa'i lha //
analyzed: nyan thos nyon mongs med pa'i lha //
translated: Sravakas are gods without afflictions

original: mi yi nyon mongs yongs spong nyid //
analyzed: mi yi nyon mongs yongs spong nyid //
translated: who completely abandon the afflictions of humans.

original: rgyal ba'i grong sogs de dag ni //🔽nyon mongs rgyun gcod nyon mongs med //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i grong sogs de dag ni // nyon mongs rgyun gcod nyon mongs med //
translated: The victors and so on in their villages and so forth

original: ces bstan pa yin no //🔽'di ltar nyan thos rnams ni grong la sogs par sems can gang dag mthong nas nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur na mi rung zhes mi'i nyon mongs pa yongs su spong bar 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no // 'di ltar nyan thos rnams ni grong la sogs par sems can gang dag mthong nas nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur na mi rung zhes mi'i nyon mongs pa yongs su spong bar 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: are without afflictions, having severed the continuum of afflictions.🔽Thus sravakas see sentient beings in villages and so on and think, It is not suitable for them to generate afflictions.

original: de rnams la lta ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams la lta ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They wish to completely abandon the afflictions of humans, but they do not look at them.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang la dmigs nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur 'byung bar ma gyur cig snyam du dgongs te ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang la dmigs nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur 'byung bar ma gyur cig snyam du dgongs te ;
translated: The Bhagavan buddhas think, May they not become a cause of affliction when they focus on me.

original: shin tu de dag lta bar bzhed nas gzigs nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu drungs nas 'byin par mdzad pa yin no //🔽smon nas mkhyen pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu de dag lta bar bzhed nas gzigs nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu drungs nas 'byin par mdzad pa yin no //🔽smon nas mkhyen pa gang zhe na /
translated: They look at them with the wish to see them and completely eliminate the cause of affliction.

original: bsam gtan la de gnas te 'di shes par bya'o zhes smon lam 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du thob ste dus gsum shes pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan la de gnas te 'di shes par bya'o zhes smon lam 'byor pas snga ma bzhin du thob ste dus gsum shes pa'am /
translated: They attain knowledge of the three times or whatever they wish to know.

original: shes par gang dang gang 'dod par 'gyur ba de dang de la shes par bya'o zhes yid kyis smon par byas nas /
analyzed: shes par gang dang gang 'dod par 'gyur ba de dang de la shes par bya'o zhes yid kyis smon par byas nas /
translated: They attain knowledge of whatever they mentally aspire to know.

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas de nas ldang ba dang / smon lam de 'grub par 'gyur zhing shes bya de yang shes so //🔽de la nyan thos rnams las sangs rgyas kyi @166a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas de nas ldang ba dang / smon lam de 'grub par 'gyur zhing shes bya de yang shes so // de la nyan thos rnams las sangs rgyas kyi @166a * //
translated: They attain knowledge of that object of knowledge after rising from meditative attainment in samādhi.

original: smon gnas mkhyen pa'i khyad par 'di yin te /
analyzed: smon gnas mkhyen pa'i khyad par 'di yin te /
translated: This is the difference between the knowledge of the buddhas and that of the śrāvakas.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: The Abhidharmakośa declares:

original: sangs rgyas smon gnas mkhyen pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas smon gnas mkhyen pa ni //
translated: The buddhas’ knowledge of the bases of prayer

original: lhun gyis grub dang bag chags spangs //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub dang bag chags spangs //
translated: is spontaneous, free of latent tendencies,🔽unimpeded, always present,

original: thogs pa med dang rtag gnas dang // 'dri la kun lan 'debs par bzhed //🔽ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thogs pa med dang rtag gnas dang // 'dri la kun lan 'debs par bzhed // ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: and responds to all questions.

original: de la lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'o //
translated: Spontaneous means engaging naturally.

original: bag chags spangs zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags spangs zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: “Elimination of habitual tendencies” means uninterrupted.

original: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Unimpeded” means engaging all objects of knowledge.

original: rtag gnas zhes bya ba ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa la 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: rtag gnas zhes bya ba ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa la 'jog pa'o //
translated: “Always abiding” means always being in equipoise.

original: 'dri ba lan kun 'debs par bzhed pa ni zhus pa'i lan thams cad 'debs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dri ba lan kun 'debs par bzhed pa ni zhus pa'i lan thams cad 'debs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: “Desiring to answer all questions” means answering all questions.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi sgo nas zhes pa ni de las bzlog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi sgo nas zhes pa ni de las bzlog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: “In terms of the śrāvakas” should be understood as the opposite of that.

original: mngon par shes pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six higher perceptions?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad pas mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad pas mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: They are the higher perception of the domain of miracles, the divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of others’ minds, the recollection of past lives, and the higher perception of the exhaustion of defilements.

original: 'di dag bshad pa ni gdams ngag rnam par 'grel pa las ji skad bshad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag bshad pa ni gdams ngag rnam par 'grel pa las ji skad bshad pa nyid yin no //
translated: The explanation of these is exactly as explained in the Commentary on the Instruction.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni bsam gtan la gnas te /🔽'di ltar rnam grangs ma rig pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni bsam gtan la gnas te / 'di ltar rnam grangs ma rig pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The correct knowledge of phenomena is based on the absorptions.🔽It is the concentration that is unobstructed in teaching the various categories of phenomena, beginning with ignorance,

original: mi shes pa dang / mi mthong ba dang / mngon par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thogs pa med par byon pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni thams cad do //🔽don so sor yang dag par rig pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams kyi don gzhan la sogs pa'i dgongs pa la thogs pa med par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyas par bstan pa yin no //🔽nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / mi mthong ba dang / mngon par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thogs pa med par byon pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni thams cad do // don so sor yang dag par rig pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams kyi don gzhan la sogs pa'i dgongs pa la thogs pa med par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyas par bstan pa yin no // nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
translated: and in teaching the various categories of phenomena, beginning with non-knowledge, non-seeing, non-realization, and so on.🔽The correct knowledge of meaning is the unobstructed knowledge of the meaning of phenomena, such as their general and specific characteristics, and of the intention of others, and so on.

original: gang yul skye bo rnams kyi skad kyis so so'i yul dang / rang dang spyi'i 'du shes tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi chos kyi nges pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: gang yul skye bo rnams kyi skad kyis so so'i yul dang / rang dang spyi'i 'du shes tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi chos kyi nges pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The correct knowledge of language is the unobstructed knowledge of the language of the people of different countries, of the different conventions of general and specific notions, and of the etymological definitions of phenomena.

original: 'di ltar 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pas de'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bya ba dang / gzugs su rung bas gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pas de'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bya ba dang / gzugs su rung bas gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is called world because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed, and because it is form, it is called form, and so on.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni gang chos kyi rab tu dbye @166b ba la thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni gang chos kyi rab tu dbye @166b ba la thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Eloquence is the correct discrimination of eloquence, which is the absence of obstruction regarding the classification of the Dharma, and so on, as before.

original: de la rab tu dbye ba ni rdzas su yod pa dang / btags par yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa zhes bya ba ste de dag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rab tu dbye ba ni rdzas su yod pa dang / btags par yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa zhes bya ba ste de dag la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, classification is the existence of substance, the existence of designation, and the existence of ultimate meaning, and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na /🔽rten gyi len pa dang / gnas pa dang / yang dag par phan 'dogs par mdzad pa la ji ltar bzhed par bzhugs pas na rten yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na / rten gyi len pa dang / gnas pa dang / yang dag par phan 'dogs par mdzad pa la ji ltar bzhed par bzhugs pas na rten yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: What are the four purities of all aspects?🔽The purity of the basis is the purity of the basis because it abides as desired in the acceptance, abiding, and perfect benefit of the basis.

original: dmigs pas sprul pa dang / yongs su bsgyur ba la ji ltar bzhed pa'i spyod pas 'jug pa'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pas sprul pa dang / yongs su bsgyur ba la ji ltar bzhed pa'i spyod pas 'jug pa'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the object is the purity of the object because it engages in conduct as desired in emanation and complete transformation of the object.

original: ye shes la mnga' brnyes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la mnga' brnyes pas na thugs yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes la mnga' brnyes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la mnga' brnyes pas na thugs yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Since he has attained mastery over intuition and mastery over concentration, he has a pure mind and pure intuition.

original: dbang bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten masteries?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽The mastery of life is the ability to remain for as many eons as there are atoms in an inexpressible number of inexpressibly numerous buddha-fields.

original: tshe la dbang ba ni 'tsho ba bzhed pa la rag las pas bsdus pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas thob ste /
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba ni 'tsho ba bzhed pa la rag las pas bsdus pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas thob ste /
translated: It is attained by the perfection of generosity, since it is dependent on the will to live.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: longs spyod byin pas sems can rnams tshe dang nges par 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod byin pas sems can rnams tshe dang nges par 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by giving wealth one is connected with the life of sentient beings.

original: sems la dbang ba ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod par sems pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: sems la dbang ba ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod par sems pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The mastery of mind is the ability to gather the mind in the way one wishes.

original: longs spyod byin pas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba'i sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod byin pas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba'i sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of the mind, since by giving wealth one follows the mind of sentient beings in accordance with their wishes.

original: yo byad la dbang ba ni /
analyzed: yo byad la dbang ba ni /
translated: The mastery of necessities is the ability to create from one thing all necessities.

original: ji ltar mngon bar 'dod pa'i mchog gi yang dag par nye bar bsdus pa de thob pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon bar 'dod pa'i mchog gi yang dag par nye bar bsdus pa de thob pa nyid yin te /
translated: It is the attainment of the supreme, perfect state that is desired.🔽

original: sems can rnams la yo byad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du yang dag par byin pa'i phyir ro //🔽las la dbang ba ni /🔽lus dang / ngag gi las ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa yang dag par bsdus pa nyid kyis thob pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la yo byad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du yang dag par byin pa'i phyir ro // las la dbang ba ni / lus dang / ngag gi las ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa yang dag par bsdus pa nyid kyis thob pa ste /
translated: It is the attainment of the supreme, just as it is desired, through the perfect bestowal of all desired goods to sentient beings.🔽Power over action is the attainment of the perfect bestowal of the desired action of body and speech.🔽Power over birth is the attainment of the perfect bestowal of the desired birth in the various realms.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs pas thob pa ste /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sems can rnams kyi lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba med pas mngon par 'dod pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs pas thob pa ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na / sems can rnams kyi lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba med pas mngon par 'dod pa'i sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Power over resolve is the attainment of the perfect bestowal of the desired magical creation and transformation.🔽Power over knowledge is the attainment of the perfect bestowal of the desired knowledge of the past and future.🔽Power over the elements is the attainment of the perfect bestowal of the desired transformation of the elements.

original: skye ba la dbang ba ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i 'gro ba'i skye bas yang dag par bsdus pa nyid kyis thob pa ste /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba la dbang ba ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i 'gro ba'i skye bas yang dag par bsdus pa nyid kyis thob pa ste /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Power over vows is the attainment of the perfect bestowal of the desired vow of the bodhisattva.🔽Power over wisdom is the attainment of the perfect bestowal of the desired wisdom of the bodhisattva.🔽Power over the Dharma is the attainment of the perfect bestowal of the desired teaching of the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i smon lam grub pa yin pa'i @167a * //🔽phyir ro // mos pa la dbang ba ni sa la sogs pa gser la sogs par dngos po ji ltar mos pa de'i rjes su 'jug pas yang dag par bsdus pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i smon lam grub pa yin pa'i @167a * // phyir ro // mos pa la dbang ba ni sa la sogs pa gser la sogs par dngos po ji ltar mos pa de'i rjes su 'jug pas yang dag par bsdus pa /
translated: because the prayers of one who is endowed with morality are fulfilled.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas thob pa yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas thob pa yin no //
translated: The power of aspiration is included in the perfection of patience, because it is attained through the completion of the perfection of patience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon gyi tshe rabs su de bzod pas sems can gyi mos pa'i rjes su zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽smon lam la dbang ba ni ji ltar smon pa bzhin du grub pas yang dag par bsdus pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi tshe rabs su de bzod pas sems can gyi mos pa'i rjes su zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // smon lam la dbang ba ni ji ltar smon pa bzhin du grub pas yang dag par bsdus pa /
translated: Because in former lives he followed the aspirations of sentient beings through patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas thob pa yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas thob pa yin te /
translated: The power of prayer is included in the perfection of vigor, because it is attained through the completion of the perfection of vigor.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: des sngon sems can thams cad kyi brtson 'grus nyams pa med par spyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sngon sems can thams cad kyi brtson 'grus nyams pa med par spyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the past he practiced the vigor of all sentient beings without decline.

original: mngon par shes pa lngas yang dag par bsdus pa /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lngas yang dag par bsdus pa /
translated: The power of knowledge is included in the five superknowledges,🔽because it is attained through the completion of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas thob pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas thob pa yin te /
translated: It is attained by perfecting the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration,

original: sngon sems can rnams kyi dgos pa ji lta ba bzhin bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon sems can rnams kyi dgos pa ji lta ba bzhin bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the past he entered into the meditative concentrations in accordance with the needs of sentient beings.

original: ye shes la dbang ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba ni /
translated: Power over knowledge

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du ye shes mngon du byed pas yang dag par bsdus pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du ye shes mngon du byed pas yang dag par bsdus pa /
translated: is included in the manifestation of knowledge in accordance with one’s wishes.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas thob pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas thob pa yin te /
translated: It is attained by perfecting the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: sngon chad sems can rnams ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du mdo la sogs pa'i chos la yang dag par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon chad sems can rnams ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du mdo la sogs pa'i chos la yang dag par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the past he correctly applied the Dharma of the sūtras and so on in accordance with the wishes of sentient beings.

original: stobs bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten powers are as follows.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of superior and nonsupreme faculties;🔽the power of knowledge of various higher interests;🔽the power of knowledge of various dhātus;🔽the power of knowledge of all paths and their respective destinations;

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of the recollection of former existences;

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: and the power of knowledge of the extinction of contaminations.

original: de rnams kyi don ni gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po'i mdo las rgya cher blta'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po'i mdo las rgya cher blta'o //
translated: The meanings of these should be understood in detail from the Sūtra of the King of Retainers of Dhāraṇī.

original: mi 'jigs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of fearlessness.

original: kye ma bdag ni yang dag par rdzogs par sangs @167b rgyas zhes dam bcas na /
analyzed: kye ma bdag ni yang dag par rdzogs par sangs @167b rgyas zhes dam bcas na /
translated: I am a perfectly enlightened Buddha.

original: de la chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya bas bdag la gang gis kyang chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas bdag bde ba dang / bag tsha ba med pa thob pa dang /
analyzed: de la chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya bas bdag la gang gis kyang chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas bdag bde ba dang / bag tsha ba med pa thob pa dang /
translated: I do not see any reason why anyone could legitimately dispute my claim that I have realized this Dharma. Therefore, I have attained happiness and fearlessness.

original: mi 'jigs pa thob pa 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa thob pa 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first fearlessness.

original: de bzhin du kye ma bdag gi zag pa thams cad zad do zhes dam bcas pa la /🔽de la zag pa 'di rnams zad par ma gyur to zhes bya bar 'dir bdag la gang gis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du kye ma bdag gi zag pa thams cad zad do zhes dam bcas pa la / de la zag pa 'di rnams zad par ma gyur to zhes bya bar 'dir bdag la gang gis kyang /
translated: Similarly, I have declared, 'I have exhausted all the defilements.'

original: chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
translated: I do not see any reason why anyone could legitimately dispute my claim that I have exhausted the defilements.🔽I have attained happiness and fearlessness.

original: de ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second fearlessness.

original: yang gang bdag gis nyan thos rnams nges par 'byung ba'i lam ston pa na de 'gags par byed cing /
analyzed: yang gang bdag gis nyan thos rnams nges par 'byung ba'i lam ston pa na de 'gags par byed cing /
translated: Again, if someone were to argue that when I teach the path of definite emergence to the disciples, it is obstructed and

original: sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: does not lead to the complete cessation of suffering,

original: zhes dam bcas pa de la sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa ma yin no zhes gang yang rgol bar mi 'gyur ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes dam bcas pa de la sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa ma yin no zhes gang yang rgol bar mi 'gyur ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: no one could oppose me, as before.

original: de ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third fearlessness.🔽Again, if someone were to argue that when I teach disciples about the factors that obstruct, it is obstructed and does not obstruct,

original: yang gang zhig bdag gis nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos su bstan pa la de 'gegs par byed cing bar du gcod pa ni ma yin no zhes bdag la sus kyang 'dir chos dang ldan par rgol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba snga ma
analyzed: yang gang zhig bdag gis nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos su bstan pa la de 'gegs par byed cing bar du gcod pa ni ma yin no zhes bdag la sus kyang 'dir chos dang ldan par rgol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba snga ma
translated: no one could oppose me, as before.

original: bzhin no // de ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin no // de ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth fearlessness.

original: bsrung ba med pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three types of absence of fear are as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sku'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sku'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata possesses completely pure physical conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sku'i spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas zhes gang zhig bcas par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sku'i spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas zhes gang zhig bcas par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
translated: Since the Tathagata has no impure physical conduct, he is called the one who has nothing to hide.

original: de ni bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de ni bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first fearlessness.

original: sku'i phrin las ji lta ba bzhin du gsung dang / thugs kyi phrin las kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sku'i phrin las ji lta ba bzhin du gsung dang / thugs kyi phrin las kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The verbal and mental activities of the Tathagata are to be understood in the same way as his physical activity.

original: dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three close placements of mindfulness:🔽When the Tathagata teaches the Dharma, some people listen with folded hands, respectfully, and place their minds in submission, but some do not.🔽The Tathagata is not pleased with those who do,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa'i tshe la la rna ba btud de gus par nyan cing bka' nyan pa'i sems nye bar 'jog pa dang / chos dang don du gnyer ba'i chos nan tan du byed pa dang des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par yang mi 'gyur /🔽yid bde @168a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa'i tshe la la rna ba btud de gus par nyan cing bka' nyan pa'i sems nye bar 'jog pa dang / chos dang don du gnyer ba'i chos nan tan du byed pa dang des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par yang mi 'gyur / yid bde @168a * //
translated: nor displeased with those who do not.

original: bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bar mi 'gyur /
translated: He is not elated or depressed,

original: thugs yeng yeng por mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / gzhan dag rna ba btud de gus par nyan pa las go bzlog pa rgyas par gsungs pa des /
analyzed: thugs yeng yeng por mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / gzhan dag rna ba btud de gus par nyan pa las go bzlog pa rgyas par gsungs pa des /
translated: The Tathagata's mind is never distracted, and he is not the opposite of those who listen with their ears and respect.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs khong khro bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs khong khro bar mi 'gyur /
translated: The Tathagata's mind is never angry,

original: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /🔽thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / la la gcig tu gus par nyan pa dang / gcig tu gus par mi nyan pa de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes pa'am /
analyzed: mi bzod par mi 'gyur / thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / la la gcig tu gus par nyan pa dang / gcig tu gus par mi nyan pa de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes pa'am /
translated: never intolerant,🔽never distrustful, and he is not pleased or displeased

original: thugs khong khro ba'am /
analyzed: thugs khong khro ba'am /
translated: with those who listen with respect or not.

original: gnyis su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis su mi 'gyur te /
translated: He is not dualistic,

original: thams cad du btang snyoms su rnam par spyod pa 'di ni dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du btang snyoms su rnam par spyod pa 'di ni dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum pa'o //
translated: but always acts with equanimity. This is the third resolve.

original: bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa la dus las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa la dus las mi 'da' ste /
translated: The Dharma of nonforgetfulness means that the Buddhas never miss the time to act for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni bya ba mdzad pa gzhan mi mnga' bar 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni bya ba mdzad pa gzhan mi mnga' bar 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is reasonable that they have no other work to do.

original: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa ni 'di na nyon mongs pa spangs pa yongs su zin kyang /
analyzed: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa ni 'di na nyon mongs pa spangs pa yongs su zin kyang /
translated: The complete destruction of habitual tendencies is as follows.🔽

original: nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa ltar spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yin par bshad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa ltar spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yin par bshad do //
translated: The complete destruction of the latent impressions is this: even though the defilements have been abandoned here, the latent impressions of the defilements are explained as the conduct as if the defilements have not been abandoned.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di ni de yang spangs shing mi mnga' bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di ni de yang spangs shing mi mnga' bas /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have abandoned that and do not possess it.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags mi mnga' zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags mi mnga' zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that they do not possess the latent impressions of the defilements.

original: thugs rje chen po ni phan par dgongs pa nyid de /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni phan par dgongs pa nyid de /
translated: Great compassion is the very intention to benefit.

original: gang gis dus thams cad du bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten la nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum rtog par mdzad do //
analyzed: gang gis dus thams cad du bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten la nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum rtog par mdzad do //
translated: By it, the Blessed One always examines the world with his vision of an Omniscient One three times each day and night.

original: ji ltar rtog par mdzad ce na //
analyzed: ji ltar rtog par mdzad ce na //
translated: How does he examine?

original: su'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni yongs su ma smin /
analyzed: su'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni yongs su ma smin /
translated: Whose roots of virtue have not ripened?

original: su'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni yongs su smin /
analyzed: su'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni yongs su smin /
translated: Whose roots of virtue have ripened?

original: su zhig mngon bar mtho ba bstan pa'i snod yin /
analyzed: su zhig mngon bar mtho ba bstan pa'i snod yin /
translated: Who is a vessel for the teaching of the high rebirth?

original: su zhig ni nges par legs pa bstan pa'i snod yin /
analyzed: su zhig ni nges par legs pa bstan pa'i snod yin /
translated: Who is a vessel for the teaching of definite goodness?

original: su zhig ni sangs rgyas su 'byor ba'i snod yin /
analyzed: su zhig ni sangs rgyas su 'byor ba'i snod yin /
translated: Who is a vessel for the attainment of Buddhahood?

original: gang zhig la ci zhig bya zhes rtog par mdzad do //
analyzed: gang zhig la ci zhig bya zhes rtog par mdzad do //
translated: What should be done for whom?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni /
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathagata has no error,

original: ca co mi mnga'o //🔽dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ca co mi mnga'o // dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no incoherence,🔽no loss of mindfulness,

original: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o //🔽thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o // thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no distraction,🔽no non-metaphysical state,🔽no nondiscrimination,

original: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
translated: no indifference due to lack of investigation,

original: 'dun pa yongs su nyams pa @168b mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa yongs su nyams pa @168b mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of interest,

original: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of effort,

original: dran pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: dran pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of mindfulness,

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of concentration,

original: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of wisdom,

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of liberation,

original: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: all his physical actions are preceded by wisdom and follow wisdom,

original: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: All the activities of his body are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge.🔽All the activities of his speech are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge.

original: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: All the activities of his mind are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go //
translated: His knowledge-vision with regard to the past is unobstructed and unattached.🔽His knowledge-vision with regard to the future is unobstructed and unattached.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go //
translated: His knowledge-vision with regard to the present is unobstructed and unattached.

original: ma 'dres pa'i bshad pa ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par rnam par 'grel pa las ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i bshad pa ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par rnam par 'grel pa las ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The explanation of the unshared qualities is in accordance with the explanation in the Unravelling the Intent Discourse.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of all aspects?

original: la la ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa bcu drug gis bsdus pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa bcu drug gis bsdus pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say it is included in the sixteen aspects of consciousness that take the four noble truths as their object.

original: gzhan dag ni de dag dang yang chos thams cad dngos po med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de dag dang yang chos thams cad dngos po med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the others are included in the knowledge of the aspect of the non-substantiality of all dharmas, of non-production, of non-cessation, of primordial calm, and of natural nirvana.

original: kha cig na re 'dir gnyen po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par 'chad par 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dir gnyen po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par 'chad par 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Some say that here it is not intended to include the knowledge of the counteragent,

original: de lta mod kyi don thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du 'chad de /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi don thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du 'chad de /
translated: but rather all the meanings are explained in their entirety.

original: de bas na yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i don kha na ma tho ba med pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i don kha na ma tho ba med pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, like a wish-fulfilling gem, it accomplishes the desired aims of all beings without fault.

original: yang gzhan dag ni rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i dbang du byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i dbang du byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is called the knowledge of all modes because it is based on the relinquishment of all modes.

original: de yang 'di ltar gzhan ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / bag chags kyi sgrib pa spangs pa rnam pa gsum char yang mnga' ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar gzhan ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / bag chags kyi sgrib pa spangs pa rnam pa gsum char yang mnga' ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Moreover, it is said that the other is the one who possesses the three kinds of abandonment: the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions, the abandonment of the obstructions to omniscience, and the abandonment of the obstructions of traces.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bshad pa 'di @169a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bshad pa 'di @169a * //
translated: The explanation of the knowledge of all aspects

original: dag thams cad kyang legs mod kyi /🔽skabs kyi shes bya'i gnas skabs la sogs pa rnam pa bcu pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pas bsdus pa'i snying po yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dag thams cad kyang legs mod kyi / skabs kyi shes bya'i gnas skabs la sogs pa rnam pa bcu pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pas bsdus pa'i snying po yod pa'i phyir /
translated: is all good,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni shin tu legs so zhes slob dpon bzang skyong gis bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni shin tu legs so zhes slob dpon bzang skyong gis bshad do //
translated: but the master Bhadra says that the knowledge of all aspects is very good because it includes the ten topics such as the basis of knowledge, and so on, and because it has a core that is not empty of the foundation consciousness and so on.

original: 'di nyid ni shin tu legs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni shin tu legs pa yin te /
translated: This is very good,

original: dmigs pa yongs su grub pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa yongs su grub pa ni /
translated: because the perfect object

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: is from the perspective of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gang la dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen dran pa yin pa dang / rnam pa zhi ba dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang la dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen dran pa yin pa dang / rnam pa zhi ba dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: Subhūti, the non-entityness of the objective support, the dominant condition of mindfulness, and the characteristic of the absence of the characteristic of possessing the aspect of peace,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: that is called the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la dran pa bdag po'i rkyen ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dran pa bdag po'i rkyen ces bya ba ni /
translated: There, the dominant condition of mindfulness is taught.

original: gang de dang der rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rab tu ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang de dang der rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rab tu ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because of the attention associated with the knowledge of all aspects in this and that, it is taught.

original: de yang 'dir ngo bo nyid chos kyi sku yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dir ngo bo nyid chos kyi sku yin no //
translated: And that is the essential nature, the Dharma body, here.

original: rgyu ni yongs su smin gyur nas //
analyzed: rgyu ni yongs su smin gyur nas //
translated: When the cause is fully ripened,🔽wherever,

original: gang dang gang la gang dang ni //
analyzed: gang dang gang la gang dang ni //
translated: whatever,

original: gang tshe bya ba phan gyur pa //
analyzed: gang tshe bya ba phan gyur pa //
translated: and whenever an action is beneficial,

original: de dang de la de snang ngo //
analyzed: de dang de la de snang ngo //
translated: that appears there.

original: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa snang ngo zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa snang ngo zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is the intention: the emanation appears.

original: de ltar byas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i mdzod la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad la ji ltar bya zhes pa'i tshul du gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i mdzod la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad la ji ltar bya zhes pa'i tshul du gnas te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśagarbha and so on remain in the manner of “What should I do for all sentient beings?”

original: sems can dman pa rnams lam la gnas su zin kyang rang gi rgyu yongs su smin pa dang bral bas da rung yang dge ba'i rtsa ba can gyi sdug bsngal las rnam par grol bar ma gyur pas 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can dman pa rnams lam la gnas su zin kyang rang gi rgyu yongs su smin pa dang bral bas da rung yang dge ba'i rtsa ba can gyi sdug bsngal las rnam par grol bar ma gyur pas 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Even though inferior sentient beings are established on the path, because they are separated from the complete ripening of their causes, they have not yet been liberated from the suffering of those with roots of virtue.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus:

original: lha yi rgyal pos char bab kyang //
analyzed: lha yi rgyal pos char bab kyang //
translated: Even though the king of gods sends down rain,

original: sa bon mi rung mi 'khrungs ltar //
analyzed: sa bon mi rung mi 'khrungs ltar //
translated: a bad seed does not grow.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung gyur kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung gyur kyang //
translated: Even though buddhas have appeared,

original: sgal pa med pas bzang mi myong //
analyzed: sgal pa med pas bzang mi myong //

original: de ni myur du 'du ba'i snga ltas te gang gis ma bsdus pa'i sems can rnams myur du sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de ni myur du 'du ba'i snga ltas te gang gis ma bsdus pa'i sems can rnams myur du sdud pa'o //
translated: This is an omen of quickly gathering [disciples], by which one quickly gathers those sentient beings who have not been gathered.

original: bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung ba ro zhim zhing bsod pa byin pas phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / bdun shin tu mtho ba ste /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung ba ro zhim zhing bsod pa byin pas phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / bdun shin tu mtho ba ste /
translated: By giving delicious, wholesome food, drink, and edibles, he has the marks of soft hands and feet, and seven elevated places.

original: de gnyis ni bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung ba ro zhim zhing bsod pa byin pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung ba ro zhim zhing bsod pa byin pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: These two are the signs of giving delicious, wholesome food, drink, and edibles.

original: bcings pa bkrol ba dang / srog gi rim gro byas pa dang / srog gcod pa spangs pas sor mo ring ba dang / rting pa yangs pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba dang / sku tshe ring ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: bcings pa bkrol ba dang / srog gi rim gro byas pa dang / srog gcod pa spangs pas sor mo ring ba dang / rting pa yangs pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba dang / sku tshe ring ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: By freeing those who are bound, by saving lives, and by abandoning killing, he has the signs of long fingers, broad heels, a large and straight body, and a long life.

original: dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa dang / dge ba bzung ba spel zhing 'grib par ma byas pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa dang / dge ba bzung ba spel zhing 'grib par ma byas pas /
translated: By taking up virtuous dharmas, by increasing the virtues one has taken up, and by not diminishing them,

original: zhabs kyi long bu mi mngon pa nyid dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa ste /🔽de ni mi mnyam pa'i chos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: zhabs kyi long bu mi mngon pa nyid dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa ste / de ni mi mnyam pa'i chos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: he has the signs of ankles that do not protrude and body hairs that point upward.🔽These are the signs of being endowed with unequalled dharmas,

original: gdul bya rnams 'dul ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams 'dul ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: or of taming those to be tamed.

original: 'dir gdul bya ni gang zhig yang dag par bsdus pa'i sems can gyi khams de yongs su @171b smin par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gdul bya ni gang zhig yang dag par bsdus pa'i sems can gyi khams de yongs su @171b smin par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Here, the disciples are those sentient beings who are gathered in the right way and are brought to full maturity.

original: rig pa dang bzo la sogs pa gus par byas te byin pa dang / mchil lham byin pas byin pa ri dags ae na ya lta bu ste /
analyzed: rig pa dang bzo la sogs pa gus par byas te byin pa dang / mchil lham byin pas byin pa ri dags ae na ya lta bu ste /
translated: Giving with respect such things as knowledge, crafts, etc. and giving shoes results in hands and feet with soft and youthful skin.

original: de ni myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas te /🔽gang zhig gzhan gyis smras pa'am /
analyzed: de ni myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas te / gang zhig gzhan gyis smras pa'am /
translated: This is a sign of quickly apprehending objects.🔽One quickly apprehends the meaning that is spoken by others

original: brdar byas pa'i don myur du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: brdar byas pa'i don myur du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: or that is indicated by gestures.

original: nor bdog pa la slong mo'i skye bo phyir ma bzlog par sbyin pa la sogs pa byas pas phyag ring zhing mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: nor bdog pa la slong mo'i skye bo phyir ma bzlog par sbyin pa la sogs pa byas pas phyag ring zhing mdzes pa ste /
translated: Giving such things as gifts without turning away those who seek goods that one possesses results in long fingers and toes and beautiful hands and feet.

original: phyag ring zhing drang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyag ring zhing drang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the fingers and toes are long and straight.

original: de la drang ba ni nor bdog cing yod pa blangs pa na sbed pa'i gya gyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la drang ba ni nor bdog cing yod pa blangs pa na sbed pa'i gya gyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, straight means that one does not deceive those who seek goods that one possesses.

original: ring ba ni slang mo ba'i skye bo phyir ma bzlog pa dang skabs rnyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring ba ni slang mo ba'i skye bo phyir ma bzlog pa dang skabs rnyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Long means that one does not turn away those who seek goods and one gives them an opportunity.

original: de ni yo byad mang ba dang / dul ba'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni sems la dbang bas ser sna gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gro ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa thul bas rnam pa thams cad du mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yo byad mang ba dang / dul ba'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni sems la dbang bas ser sna gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gro ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa thul bas rnam pa thams cad du mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are the signs of having many possessions and being disciplined.🔽These are the signs of having many sons and daughters.🔽These are the signs of having many friends, relatives, and kinsmen.🔽These are the signs of being a universal monarch.🔽These are the signs of being a wheel-turning king.🔽These are the signs of being a king of the pure-abode gods.

original: grogs po dang / mdza' bshes dang / gnyen 'dab ma phye ba dang / bye bar gyur pa'i sems can bsdums pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gsang ba'i tshig yongs su bsrungs pas mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa ste /
analyzed: grogs po dang / mdza' bshes dang / gnyen 'dab ma phye ba dang / bye bar gyur pa'i sems can bsdums pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gsang ba'i tshig yongs su bsrungs pas mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa ste /
translated: These are the signs of being Śakra, lord of the gods.

original: da ni bu mang ba'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ji srid par sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni bu mang ba'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ji srid par sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are the signs of being a god of the Thirty-Three.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Yāma heaven.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Tuṣita heaven.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Nirmāṇarati heaven.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Paranirmitavaśavartin heaven.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Brahmā heaven.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Ābhāsvara heaven.

original: stan dang / gos dang / khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po byin pas /
analyzed: stan dang / gos dang / khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po byin pas /
translated: These are the signs of being a god of the Śubhakṛtsna heaven.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Bṛhatphala heaven.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Avṛha heaven.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Atapa heaven.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Sudarśana heaven.🔽These are the signs of being a god of the Akaniṣṭha heaven.

original: mdog gser dang 'dra ba dang / pags pa shin tu 'dzam pa ste ;
analyzed: mdog gser dang 'dra ba dang / pags pa shin tu 'dzam pa ste ;
translated: His skin is smooth.

original: de gnyis ni gdan dang / na bza' dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po thob pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni gdan dang / na bza' dang / gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po thob pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: These two are omens of obtaining a good seat, clothes, celestial mansion, and abode.

original: 'du 'dzi spangs pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / pha ma dang / phu nu dang / sring mo la sogs pa bla ma rnams la ji ltar 'jam par rim gro byas pa dang / btsun par byas pa dang / bcol ba la bsgo ba rna la ma gzan pas /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi spangs pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / pha ma dang / phu nu dang / sring mo la sogs pa bla ma rnams la ji ltar 'jam par rim gro byas pa dang / btsun par byas pa dang / bcol ba la bsgo ba rna la ma gzan pas /
translated: He has a curl of hair between his eyebrows, which is a sign of having served and venerated gurus such as preceptors, instructors, parents, brothers, sisters, and so forth, with a gentle mind, with respect, and with what they have requested.

original: sbu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba dang / zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa ste /🔽de ni mnyam pa med pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: sbu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba dang / zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa ste / de ni mnyam pa med pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: He has a protuberance on the head, which is a sign of being unequaled.

original: mi snyan pa mi zer zhing mi smod par snyan par smra zhing legs par bshad pa la @172a * //
analyzed: mi snyan pa mi zer zhing mi smod par snyan par smra zhing legs par bshad pa la @172a * //
translated: He has a melodious voice, which is a sign of not speaking unpleasantly or disparagingly, but speaking pleasantly and in agreement with what is well explained.🔽He has the upper body of a lion, which is a sign of not being frightened by the profound and extensive Dharma.

original: mthun par 'dzin pas ro stod seng ge'i lta bu dang / dbung mgo shin tu zlum par grub pa ste /
analyzed: mthun par 'dzin pas ro stod seng ge'i lta bu dang / dbung mgo shin tu zlum par grub pa ste /
translated: He has shoulders that are well rounded, which is a sign of having given away one's own flesh and so forth to those who requested it.

original: de ni thub pa med pa'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni ye shes dang mthu thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thub pa med pa'i snga ltas so zhes bya ba ni ye shes dang mthu thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the sign of his invulnerability, because his knowledge and power are unobstructed.

original: nad pa rnams la sman dang / rim gro dang / sman pa dang / phan pa'i zas byin pa dang rim gro byas pas thal gong rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni phrag so gnyis kyi phyogs sha rgyas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nad pa rnams la sman dang / rim gro dang / sman pa dang / phan pa'i zas byin pa dang rim gro byas pas thal gong rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni phrag so gnyis kyi phyogs sha rgyas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has a broad chest, because he has given medicine, service, doctors, and wholesome food to the sick and has served them. This is the sign of his broad chest, because it is the expansion of the flesh on both sides of the chest.

original: ro bro ba'i mchog mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa brnyes pa nges pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi ljags kyi dbang po ro mi zhim pa dag dang / ljags kyi dbang por phyin pa dang / ro mchog nyid du so sor ba dar par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: ro bro ba'i mchog mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa brnyes pa nges pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi ljags kyi dbang po ro mi zhim pa dag dang / ljags kyi dbang por phyin pa dang / ro mchog nyid du so sor ba dar par mdzad pa ste /
translated: He has the knowledge of the best of tastes, because he has attained the result of his actions, and because the Lord has made his tongue sense-faculty taste the best of tastes, and has made it so that it does not experience bad tastes.

original: de ni nad nyung ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni nad nyung ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is the sign of his having little illness.

original: skyed mos tshal dang / kun dga' ra ba dang / btung ba dang / rdzing bu dang / rgal dka' ba la zam pa dang / kha zas dang / gtsug lag khang gi phreng ba dang / stegs dang / gtsug lag khang la sogs pa gzhan mos par bya ba sngon du song zhing bdag gis gzhan la byin pas /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal dang / kun dga' ra ba dang / btung ba dang / rdzing bu dang / rgal dka' ba la zam pa dang / kha zas dang / gtsug lag khang gi phreng ba dang / stegs dang / gtsug lag khang la sogs pa gzhan mos par bya ba sngon du song zhing bdag gis gzhan la byin pas /
translated: Parks, groves, drinks, ponds, bridges over difficult river crossings, food, rows of temples, platforms, and other temples that are pleasing to others, having been given to others by me,🔽

analyzed: shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He has a broad chest like a lion,🔽a broad chest like a lion,🔽a broad chest like a lion,🔽a broad chest like a lion,🔽a broad chest like a lion,
